loans.name: Elaine

texts.en: Mary is 40 years old and lives in Airport, Liberia. She is living with her boyfriend, and has three children between the ages of 14 and 20 that are currently in school and living with her oldest sister. For the past 4 years, she has been selling gasoline in her community since she lives close to the road. She is requesting a loan to purchase more gasoline for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Zoila Blanca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Zoila; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una institucion publica ,ella trabaja durante el dia ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este trabajo el cual le va bien ,la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the "Choquequirao" community bank; she lives in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. 

The partner is Zoila; she balances her daily activities while working at a public institution during the day, she's been at this job for a long time and she does well, she is a joyful and responsible person with dreams to keep going, being this the only way she can get her family ahead.

She requests a loan to pay for her children's tuition.  She values and thanks the loan provided and commits to repay according to schedule.

loans.use: to pay for her children's studies.

loans.name: Eblin Armando

texts.es:
Eblin, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, solamente él trabaja por que su esposa es ama de casa, él se dedica a la agricultura, con este trabajo ha logrado que en su hogar no falte lo necesario para la alimentación.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como abono, herbicidas, que son necesarios para la siembra, esta compra le permitirá tener lo necesario y realizar su trabajo en la agricultura.
La aspiración de Eblin es tener mejores cosechas, con la ayuda del préstamo espera mejorar los resultados del cultivo.
texts.en: Eblin lives with his wife and two children, his wife is a homemaker and he works in agriculture, with this work he has been able to achieve that at his home no food is needed.  He is requesting a loan to to buy agricultural products such as fertilizer and herbicide, which are needed for sowing season, this purchase will allow him to have what's needed and do his agriculture work.  Eblin wishes to have better harvest with the help of this loan he hopes for better results for his crop.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products such as fertilizer and herbicide.

loans.name: Heri Ya Mungu Group

texts.fr: La cliente mukeina,leader du groupe d’affaire «Heri ya Mungu »,est entrepreneur,âgée de 34 ans,mariée, mère de 6 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous.Son mari est un officiel de l’Etat. Elle est sociétaire d’une officine pharmaceutique. Elle a commencé cette entreprise alors qu’elle démissionna d’une clinique privée. Il y a 4 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 3eme crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec quelques boites de médicaments essentiels et génériques (paracétamol, antibiotiques, aspirines, anti paludéen, anti diarrhéiques, pommades, glucosé, etc.). En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et ouvrir sa clinique privée. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
The client Mikeina, leader of the "Heri ya Mungu" business group, is an entrepreneur. She is 34 years old, married, and mother of six young children, who are all in school. Her husband is a State official.

She is a part-owner of a pharmacy. She started this business when she retired from a private clinic. She has been performing little revenue-generating activities like this for four years now. Meanwhile, she just received her third loan from Hekima.

This new loan will allow her to stock up on boxes of essential, generic medicine (paracetamol, antibiotics, aspirin, anti-malarial, anti-diarrheal, ointments, medicine containing glucose, etc.). She also hopes to open her own clinic and see her children grow up comfortably. The client would like to thank Hekima for helping poor women who do not have access to classic banking. It should be noted that some of the clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy essential, generic medicine (paracetamol, antibiotics, aspirin, anti-malarial, anti-diarrheal, ointment, medicine containing glucose, etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: La Fraternite Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bujiriri, leader du groupe de crédit «La fraternité », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 35 ans, divorcée, mère de 7 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuses de poissons. Elle a commencé cette entreprise de lors qu’elle divorça avec son ex mari. Il y a 4 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  5eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec 2 paniers de poissons,etc. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et construire une maison pour ses enfants. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en: Bujiriri, leader of the loan group "La Fraternité," is a 35-year-old entrepreneur. She is divorced and has seven young children, who all go to school. She sells fish, having started the business at the time of her divorce. She has been involved in these small, income-producing activities for four years. However, she has just received her fifth loan from Hekima. This new loan will allow her to buy two baskets of fish, etc.  In addition, she would like to see her children grow up, and build a house for her children. Bujiriri is grateful to Hekima for helping poor women excluded from traditional banks to become independent. It is worth pointing out that some clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of fish, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: La señora Amalia tiene 46 años, estudio tan solo hasta el nivel primario, convive con el señor Felipe de 36 años, tienen dos hijos donde uno ingreso a la universidad pública y el otro esta cursando el nivel secundario en una escuela fiscal de la zona donde radica, fue criada por su madre a la cual colaboró con la cría de chanchos, una vez que se concubino le dieron su herencia donde actualmente vive con su familia a lado de la casa de su madre que es mayor de edad y a la cual colabora con los gastos, la zona donde radica es en la Maica de la ciudad de Cochabamba que es una de las zonas de mayor producción de leche pura de todo el departamento; como esta zona es apta para el rubro la señora saco un préstamo hace menos de un año para empezar a criar vacas de raza mejorada, las cuales ahora producen leche y además elabora quesillo que son comercializados a rescatistas de la zona. La señora Amalia está pidiendo el crédito ya que se le presento una oportunidad de comprar forraje para sus vacas a un menor costo.
texts.en: Amalia, 46, only received an elementary education.  She lives with her husband, Felipe, 36, and their two children, one of whom studies at the public university and the other is in high school.  Amalia was raised by her mother who she helped to raise pigs.  When she got married she received her inheritance, which is where she lives now with her family, next door to her mother who is elderly and who she helps support.  The area where she resides is called La Maica in the city of Cochabamba, which is one of the largest dairy producers in the department.  Since this area is apt for livestock farming, Amalia requested a loan less than a year ago to begin raising a good breed of cattle which are now producing milk.  She also makes cheese which she sells to distributors in the area.  Amalia is requesting a loan because she has to opportunity to buy lower cost fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: To buy fodder for her cattle.

loans.name: Astrid Yusibeth

texts.es:
Astrid, está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, ya que ha decidido instalar en la joyeria una tienda, esto le ayudara para surtir el negocio y poder mantener lo necesario para ofrecer a los clientes como boquitas, galletas, gaseosas, huevos, embutidos y pan. Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para incrementar el negocio en la joyeria y aumentar las ventas.
Ella considera que a través de estos préstamos lograra superarse y mejorar las condiciones económicas de la familia.
texts.en:
Astrid is requesting a loan to buy essential groceries since she decided to open a grocery store in her jewelry business.  This will help her stock everything she needs to offer her customers such as snacks, cookies, sodas, eggs, sausage and bread.  She believes the previous loan helped her increase her jewelry business and sales.

She feels that the loans help her get ahead and improve her family's economic situation.

loans.use: To buy snacks, cookies, sodas, eggs, sausage and bread.

loans.name: Rigoberto Ernesto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, se ha decido por un nuevo préstamo, para comprarse un herramienta que le ayude a mejorar su producción de ropa de vestir, comprándose una máquina de coser y tela de diferentes colores, para mejorar y estabilizar el taller de costura.
Él considera que su condición ha mejorado y está gozando de buena salud para continuar trabajando con su esposa.
texts.en: Rigoberto has decided to request a new loan to buy a tool that will help him improve his clothing production.  He wants to buy a sewing machine and different colored fabric to improve and stabilize his sewing business.  He feels his situation has improved and he is in good health to continue working alongside his wife.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and different colored fabric.

loans.name: Agustin Antonio Rodriguez Reyes

texts.es: Agustín Antonio tiene 46 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es brindar los servicios de transporte ya tiene clientes fijos a los que le brinda su servicio, el emprendedor tiene tres hijos pero el mayor trabaja solo los dos menores son los que tiene a cargo de él y están estudiando todavía. Agustín Antonio está solicitando financiamiento para comprar llantas, aceite, y darle mantenimiento al vehículo para brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Agustín Antonio, 46, earns a living offering transportation services to a fixed customer base.  This entrepreneur has three children, the eldest of whom works, so the younger two school-aged children are still in his care.  

Agustín Antonio is requesting a loan to buy tires and oil, and to pay for maintenance for his vehicle so he can provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: To buy tires and oil, and pay for vehicle maintenance to give his customers better service.

loans.name: Maria Irma De La Paz

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque son un buen recurso económico que le ayuda en el comercio y en sus condiciones personales, ella invertirá en la compra de concentrado para alimentar a los cerdos y aves de corral, tambien comprara una vaquilla.
Ella ha logrado  incrementar el negocio, haciéndolo más estable, ya que compro más cerdos, sus condiciones de vida personal y familiar han tenido un impacto positivo, pues sus ingresos económicos se han incrementado, ya que el negocio es más productivo y provechoso.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan because it is a good economic resource that helps in her business and personal situation.  She plans to use it to buy concentrated animal feed for the pigs and chickens, as well buy a calf.

She has been able to increase her business, making it more stable, by buying more pigs.  This has had an impact on her personal and family living conditions, since her income has increased and the business is more productive and profitable.

loans.use: To buy concentrated animal feed for her pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Bacilisa

texts.es:
Bacilisa se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche,huevos y galletas,la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia tambien vende pizzas desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar sus negocios de tienda de abarrotes y tambien ampliar el negocio de venta de pizzas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas y tambien para comprar insumos para hacer pizzas como harina y embutidos al por mayor. 
o
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bacilisa makes a living with her grocery store business. She sells essential products like rice, sugar, milk, eggs, and cookies. She begins selling at 8:00am until 6:00pm. She also sells pizzas from 5:00am until 10:00pm. By means of these businesses she gets her children ahead. Her dream is to expand her grocery store and pizza businesses. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies, and also to buy supplies with which to make pizzas like wholesale flour, sausage, and ham.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to fulfilling her payments.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies, and also to buy supplies with which to make pizzas like wholesale flour, sausage, and ham.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los Arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 53 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 8 hijos, todos mayores de edad tres aun viven en su casa, el menor de ellos estudia en la universidad. El marido se dedica a la albañilería.
 
Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo y en especial a su hijos en los gastos de estudios se dedica al comercio, tiene una papelería y copiadora en su casa,  allí vende útiles escolares y también aguas, helados, sodas, jugos,  ciertas golosinas y bocadillos de picar, tiene muy buenas ventas ya que  su negocio está cerca de una escuela y aprovecha para vender y realizar los trabajos a los estudiantes de dicho plantel, lleva en su negocio por más de 15 años y lo ha ido mejorando gracias a los créditos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar útiles escolares ya que está por llegar la época de entrada a clases y tiene que surtirse para esta época. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho.
 
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the parish of Crucita of the Portoviejo canton, we find a place known as Los Arenales. Here the members of the communal bank Nueva Generación meet every two weeks. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and the warmth of its people. 

This is where Ana lives. She is 53 years old and in a common law marriage with 8 children. All of them are grown and three still live in her house. The youngest goes to college. Her husband is a bricklayer. 
 
She is a good mother and housewife. To help her husband and especially her children to pay for their education, she is a merchant. She has a paper store and a copier in her house. She sells school supplies and also water, ice cream, sodas, juices, some candies and some snacks. She has very good sales since her business is close to a school and she is able to sell to and do jobs for the students there. She has had her business for more than 15 years and has been improving it thanks to the loans.  
 
This loan is to buy school supplies since school is starting soon and she has to stock up. She has been in the communal bank almost since it started and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot. 
 
Her dream is to keep working and improving her business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Freddy Jose Ruiz Mendoza

texts.es: Freddy José tiene 40 años de edad, su negocio al que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general ya tiene años de experiencia en el negocio, tiene ya clientes fijos y eventuales a quienes les ofrece su producto siempre variedad muchos de ellos son de algunas de la empresa de la localidad . El emprendedor tiene a su cargo dos hijos y están estudiando todavía y le brinda lo mejor cada día.  Freddy José  está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, camisas, calzados, sandalias, blúmer, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Freddy José is 40 years old. He makes a living in the business of selling general supplies. As he has years of experience in this activity he has regular customers who he offers his products to. He always has a variety of products to offer to his customers, some of whom are from the local company. 

This businessman has to care for two children who are still studying and he gives them the best every day. Freddy José is requesting this loan to buy trousers, shirts, footwear, sandals, underwear, and other items.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, footwear, sandals, underwear, and other items.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 17 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Joy has been working hard to manage her small hotel, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Joy has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, and will help Joy generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Joy hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Joy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training. The ELA program has increased Joy's future prospects by helping her to get money to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
Joweria lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children, and all her children are in school. She has additional family members. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy passion fruit, watermelon and jack fruits. Her major business challenges are perishability and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand into a wholesale business and also to buy a deep freezer. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more passion fruit, oranges and watermelon.

loans.name: Margarita Isabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los Arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Margarita, tiene 54 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive con la mamá y su hermana que tiene tres hijos.

Ella para ganarse la vida se dedica tanto a la agricultura como al comercio, en  época de invierno ella siembra cultivos de arroz y verduras, en la actualidad tiene sembrado varias hectáreas de arroz, en esta época contrata dos personas para que le realicen los trabajos y el cuidado de sus cultivos por cuanto este es un trabajo duro que ella no puede realizar. En época de verano ella administra el bar en una escuela de la localidad en la cual vende diversos alimentos preparados para los pequeños.

Este crédito es para comprar insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para obtener una buena cosecha. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda y facilidad para conseguir los créditos.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante con su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the parish Crucita, canton of Portoviejo, we find a place known as Los Arenales. The members of the communal bank Grupo de Crédito Nueva Generación meet here every fifteen days. This place is renown for its beautiful beaches, its gastronomy and the friendliness of its inhabitants.

Here is where Margarita lives. She is 54 years old, single and lives with her mother and sister, who has three children.

She makes a living both in farming and in retail. In the winter season she sows rice and vegetable crops, and at present she has sown various hectares of rice. In this season she hires two people to carry out the work and care for her crops as this is a hard job which she cannot do herself. In the summer she runs the bar of a local school which sells a range of prepared foods for the school children.

This loan is to buy farming supplies and fertilizers in order to obtain a good harvest. She has been a member of the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it for the help provided and the ease with which she can obtain the loans.

Her dreams are to continue progressing with her business and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II, tiene 65 años, es dueña de una bodega, es madre de 5 hijos, es socia de Finca  Perú desde hace 10 años, gracias a los prestamos recibidos Justina pudo hacer su casa y alquilar, ha ampliado con ambientes su casa y alquilando tiene mas entradas aparte de su Bodega, todo este tiempo pudo aprender mas acerca del valor del ahorro y poco a poco progresar. Ahora con el préstamo que solicita  lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza, gaseosa y licores.
texts.en: Justina is a member of the Unión II communal bank. She is 65 and the owner of a small store. She is the mother of 5 children and has been a member of Finca Perú for ten years. Thanks to the loans, Justina was able to make her house and rent it out. She has enlarged parts of her house and by renting has more income apart from her store. She is always learning more about the value of savings and progressing little by little. Now, with the loan she is asking for she will invest in buying beer, soft drinks and liquor.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Assa

texts.en:
Assa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children, and all her children are in school. She takes care of one additional family member (her sister’s child). Assa sells crafts at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more crafts like mats and baskets. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters.  She generates additional income through selling secondhand clothes. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling secondhand bags and also to become a wholesaler. 

She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more mats and baskets for resale.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children, and all her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members (three young sisters). She sells secondhand clothes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the increasing prices of used clothes. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling secondhand bags and also to open up a boutique. She lives in a rented house where the family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los Arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ida, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad y uno vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.
 
Ella para obtener algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de mariscos en su casa, lugar en el cual tiene un pequeño pero bien surtido local, en su negocio los clientes encuentran del todo ya que ella les ofrece: camarón, langostinos, cangrejos, pescado en muchas variedades, conchas, entre otras cosas y todas de muy buena calidad ya que esta es su garantía y es por esto que sus clientes la prefieren, lleva más de  20 años  con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar toda clase de mariscos para darles a sus clientes lo mejor. Está en el en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio  y le gusta porque sus compañeras son unidas y confiables.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que en la que vive es de sus padres.
texts.en:
In the parish Crucita, canton of Portoviejo, we find a place known as Los Arenales. The members of the communal bank Grupo de Crédito Nueva Generación meet here every fifteen days. This place is renowned for its beautiful beaches, its gastronomy and the friendliness of its inhabitants.

Here we met Ida. She is 49 years old, married and from this relationship she has two adult children, one of whom lives with her. Her husband makes a living in retail.

In order to obtain something for herself and be able to contribute towards the household bills she makes a living selling seafood in her house, where she has a small but well stocked store. In this store her customers can find all sorts of things which she sells: shrimps, prawns, crabs, many varieties of fish, shells, among other things. All her products are good quality as this is her guarantee to her customers and for this reason they come to her. She has carried out this activity for more than 20 years and it is going very well.

This loan is to buy all sorts of seafood to offer her customers the best. She has been a member of the communal bank from its beginning and she likes it because its members are all united and trustworthy.

Her dream is to have her own house as where she lives is her parents house.

loans.use: to buy all sorts of seafood.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 27 años de edad casado con la señora Julia más de 4 años, saben leer y escribir, tienen 1 hijo dependiente que estudia en nivel primaria, la familia vive en la comunidad de Canco hacia el norte de Colomi de la ciudad de Cochabamba más de 4 años.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Su principal actividad económica es producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca, papaliza, cultiva en terreno que es una  herencia de sus padres aproximadamente 1 ha,  de esta forma el mantiene a su familia, el señor José nos cuenta que hicieron construir su vivienda pero faltaba la muralla y no les alcanzo dinero que tenían ahorrado por este motivo ellos se apersonaron a nuestra oficina de CIDRE IFD a solicitar un préstamo para hacer construir la muralla de su vivienda, se llevaron una respuesta positiva por lo cual se sienten muy felices.
Con la muralla construida  su casita estará más seguro sin que estén preocupados cada vez que salgan  de su casa, José nos cuenta que en otras Entidades Financieras le negaron el crédito ya que les pidieron muchos requisitos.
Entre sus sueños y metas es terminar totalmente la construcción de su casa y que su hijo siga estudiando hasta obtener una carrera profesional para que de esa manera pueda tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old. He has been married to Julia for more than 4 years. They know how to read and write and have 1 dependent child who is in primary school. The family has lived in the community of Canco in the northern part of Colomi of the city of Cochabamba for more than 4 years. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 His main activity is farming potatoes, beans, oca, and papaliza. He grows his crops on approximately 1 hectare, land he inherited from his parents. This is how he supports his family. Jose tells us that he built his house but it was lacking a wall around it and the money the had saved up wasn't enough. That is why they came to our office in CIDRE IFD to ask for a loan to build a wall around their house. The answer was yes and they are very happy.  

When the wall it built, their house will be safer and they won't have to worry every time they leave the house. José tells us that other financial entities denied them the loan since they had a lot of requirements. 

One of his dreams and goals is to totally finish building their house and for his son to keep going to school until he has a professional degree so that he can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 8 children, and 2 of her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She is a poultry farmer. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of poultry feed and feeders. Her major business challenges are the increasing prices of chicken feeds and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to own 2,000 laying birds, and she also wants to educate her children up to university level. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed and feeders.

loans.name: Fabio Manuel Barceló Castro

texts.es: Fabio tiene su propio negocio de vender meriendas que el mismo empaca. El compra en grandes cantidades de pasabocas como chitos, papitas, snacks, jugos y rompecabezas infantiles  los empaca en paquetes  individuales  y forma la merienda que niños y niñas llevan a su colegio. Fabio no vende al consumidor final, lo hace a través de intermediarios como tiendas y colegios, que el mismo contacta y cuando le hacen pedidos envía a sus 3 promotoras, para que estas los distribuyan.  Su negocio crece cada vez más,  desde que quedó desempleado de una empresa en otra ciudad que se dedicada a la venta de confites y desde ese momento empezó a visionarse como emprendedor y hoy propietario de su negocio de empacar y vender meriendas escolares. En la actualidad planea acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace alas Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará de pasabocas como chitos, papitas, snacks, jugos y rompecabezas infantiles , para armar sus paquetes de merienditas , que deleitarán a niños y adultos  y aumentarán su volumen de ventas,  lo que  hace que esta inversión sea ex
texts.en:
Fabio has his own business selling snacks which he himself packs. He buys great quantities of snacks such as chitos, chips, snacks, juices and children's puzzles, he packs them in individual packages and makes a snack which boys and girls take to school. Fabio doesn't sell to the final consumer, he sells through intermediaries such as shops and schools. He contacts with them and when they make orders he sends his three promoters to distribute the products.

His business is continually growing. When he was laid off from a company in another city, he starting making a living selling sweets and from that moment he saw himself as an entrepreneur. Today he is the owner of his business packaging and selling school snacks.

Presently he plans to request a loan from Credikiva, which will be his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan he will buy snacks such as chitos, chips, snacks, juices and children's puzzles to fill his snack packages. These will delight both children and adults and will increase the number of sales, which will make this investment successful.

loans.use: to buy snacks such as chitos, chips, snacks, juices and children's puzzles

loans.name: Fátima Teodora

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los Arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Fátima, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 y 3 años de edad, el mayor este año entra al jardín de infantes. El marido se dedica a la pesca y la agricultura. 

Ella es una muy buena esposa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza los créditos para que él los utilice en sus actividades, pues por temporadas se dedica a la pesca y otras a la agricultura, en la actualidad y aprovechando la época de invierno él tiene sembríos de maíz, maní y ciertas verduras,  trabaja en el agro cuatro días a la semana y a veces también junto con otras personas se embarcan a alta mar para realizar las faenas de pesca.  Es así como ellos pueden salir adelante y más aun con la ayuda de los créditos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para obtener una buena cosecha. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los  créditos. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus niños.
texts.en:
In the parish Crucita, canton of Portoviejo, we find a place known as Los Arenales. The members of the communal bank Grupo de Crédito Nueva Generación meet here every fifteen days. This place is renowned for its beautiful beaches, its gastronomy and the friendliness of its inhabitants.

Here is where Fátima lives. She is 23 years old, and lives in free union from which she has two children, aged 4 and 3. The oldest start nursery school this year. Her husband makes a living fishing and farming.

She is a good wife who, to help her husband, requests loans which she invests in his activities. Some seasons he makes a living in fishing and others in farming. At the moment, making the most of the winter season, he has corn, peanut and some vegetable crops. He works in farming four days a week and sometimes together with others they sail out to sea to carry out their fishing activities. This is how they manage to get ahead, even more so with the help of the loans.

This loan is to buy farming supplies and fertilizers in order to obtain a good harvest. This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it for the help provided by the loans.

Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose Concepcion

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para darle continuidad al negocio y mejorar sus ventas, él comprara ropa nueva como blusas, camisas, pantalones, faldas, artículos plásticos, para mejorar el inventario del negocio y mejorar la atención y el servicio a los clientes.
Él considera que él préstamo anterior le ayudo para mejorar y ofertar buenos productos de calidad, dándole una mejor opción para la venta.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to carry on with his activity and improve his sales. He will buy new items of clothing such as blouses, shirts, trousers, skirts and plastic items to stock up his activity and to improve the care and the service he offers to his customers.
He thinks that the previous loan has been of great help in improving the quality of his products and in offering them to his customers, thus giving him better sales opportunities.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, trousers, skirts and plastic items.

loans.name: Osveida

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los Arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Osbeida,  tiene 65 años  de edad, es madre soltera de 12  hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, con ella aun viven tres de sus hijos los cuales aun están solteros.

Ella para ganarse la vida y sacar adelante a sus hijos después de la pérdida de su esposo, desde hace varios años se dedica al comercio, instalo un pequeño bar en su casa ya que que hasta esta localidad llegan muchos turistas, vende, empanadas, corviches, gaseosas, jugos y otras bebidas, además los fines de semana también prepara y vende el delicioso ceviche de pescado el cual es muy apetecido por los turistas que llegan hasta el lugar. Trabaja de miércoles a domingo  desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00, lleva más de 15 años con su negocio y gracias a Dios le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar aceite, plátano, maní y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos.  Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que les ofrece el banco.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Nueva Generación' community bank meet in a place known as Los Arenales, in Crucita parish, in Portoviejo canton.  This place is well known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

This is where we meet Osveida.  Osveida is 65 years old and the single mother of 12 children who are all now grown up.  Three of her children are still single and live with her.

In order to earn a living and provide for her children since the loss of her husband, Osveida has been running a business for some years.  She set up a small cafe in her home because many tourists come to her town.  There she sells empanadas, corviches, soda, juice and other drinks.  On weekends, she also prepares and sells delicious 'ceviche' (a marinated fish dish) which is very popular with the tourists who come here.  She works from Wednesday to Sunday, from 8.00am to 3.00pm.  She has more than 15 years experience in her business and, thanks to God, it is doing very well.

Osveida will use this loan to buy oil, bananas, peanuts and other ingredients that she needs for preparing her food.  She is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because of the benefits the bank offers.  Her dream is to own a great restaurant.

loans.use: to buy oil, bananas, peanuts and other food products

loans.name: Marleni

texts.en:
Marleni continues to focus on her clothing-sales business, which she has run for about two and a half years. She is 28 years old and raising a 5-year-old son with her partner. She used to have a store where she sold clothing at retail. Now she focuses exclusively on selling items such as pants, blouses, sweaters and polo shirts at wholesale. 

Marleni is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothing at wholesale from Lima, which she then sells to businesses in Cusco. One day, she wants to open a storefront where she can display and sell at wholesale.

Marleni is a member of the village bank "Los Diamantes" in Cusco, which is receiving its sixteenth loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha, a 54-year-old divorced mother of five children between 28 and 35 years old, all living independently, has been running a small grocery store for about one year. Previously working as part of the cleaning staff in hostels, Bertha is now requesting a loan to purchase grocery merchandise such as rice, sugar, olives, oil and pasta. This is her first loan from Arariwa, and while she is appreciative of the loan, she says that she prefers to depend on her own resources and abilities in order to get ahead. She is commited to making her loan repayments on schedule.

Bertha is a member of the village bank Los Diamantes in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, olives, oil, and pasta for her store.

loans.name: Vasil Chapurishvili

texts.en:
Vasil is 34 years old. He lives in the Akhmeta district of East Georgia with his family, including his wife, Nina, 13-year-old son, 4-year-old daughter and grandmother. Nina works as a dentist assistant in Akhmeta. 

Vasil is leading the agricultural business of the family. They have a farm with a milk cow, a calf and two pigs. Vasil produces cheese and sells it to local dairy products retailers. On average, he sells 20 piglets per year at the local market. The family also owns a vineyard with 1,200 vine trees. Vasil produces wine and sells it from his house. The total average monthly income of the family is 750 GEL, including the pension of Vasil’s grandmother. 

Vasil has requested credit to expand his family farm. With the borrowed amount, he will purchase two milk cows, enabling him to produce and sell 200 percent more cheese. This will increase the income of the family by at least 300 GEL. Vasil plans to use the increased income to create better living conditions for his children and other family members.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows.

loans.name: Cinforosa

texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Los Diamantes” (The Diamonds) communal bank, located in the Cusco district. Cinforosa is 59 years old. She is married and has three children who are now living independently. She continues to operate her business selling food. She prepares typical dishes for lunch and dinner, and serves customers from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. She has been in this business for 12 years. Prior to this, she sold milk. 

Cinforosa wants to expand her business and is asking for this loan so that she can buy ingredients such as oil, rice and potatoes. One day she would like to have her own store to sell food rather than a stand in the market. Our associate appreciates the people who will help make this dream possible and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook with such as oil, rice and potatoes.

loans.name: Vazha Pughiashvili

texts.en:
Vazha is 29 years old. He lives in the Kvareli district of East Georgia with his family, including his wife, Eter, 10-year-old daughter and 5-year-old son. Vazha's daughter goes to the local school and his son goes to kindergarten. Eter is a housewife. 

Vazha is an artisan. He works on flooring, installing Dutch tiles and painting walls. He works in the villages and town of his district, where he gets orders. His total average monthly income is 700 GEL.

Vazha has requested credit to purchase additional equipment for his work. With new, modern equipment and tools, Vazha will be able to provide better quality service to his clients, enabling him to attract new clients and increase his income. He will use the increased income to create better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for flooring and painting.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
A teacher for 20 years, Soledad continues alternating her daily activities, producing and selling knitwear and teaching 4-5 year olds at a primary school. Soledad is 52 years old and married with two children of her own, a 23-year-old daughter and a 14-year-old son. Currently she is requesting a loan in order to buy more yarn for her knitwear business. Soledad knits scarves, sweaters, and vests based on original designs.

Soledad’s dream is to start exporting knit products. She envisions forming a textile cooperative with a group of mothers in the countryside who make knitwear from raw alpaca and sheep wool tinted with natural dyes. The new business would provide training in order to assure production of high quality knits, as well as export to other countries.

Soledad is a member of the village bank Los Diamantes in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan.

loans.use: to buy yarn to make handknit scarves, sweaters, and vests.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 48 years old and married with four children between the ages of 19 and 29. Two of her children live separately from her while the other two still live with her while they attend a university. 

Hilda's occupation is selling crafts such as handmade dolls, leather and textile wallets, and pencil and cosmetic cases. Although Hilda buys most of the handicrafts from local artisans in Cusco, she produces the dolls herself. The dolls wear traditional Peruvian costumes handmade from old blankets, which feature a variety of colorful woven designs. Hilda has been selling these products for about nine years. While she used to sell the crafts in Cusco, she now sells exclusively in Lima and Bolivia.

Hilda is requesting a loan in order to buy materials such as old blankets, cotton and fabric to produce her handmade dolls. She hopes that in addition to continuing her sales in Lima and Bolivia, she will be able to open a shop selling handicrafts in Cusco.

Hilda is a member of the village bank Los Diamantes in Cusco, which is receiving its sixteenth loan.

loans.use: to buy old blankets, cotton and fabric to make handmade dolls.

loans.name: Alicia Melitonia

texts.es: Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II, tiene 44 años, es madre de 5 hijos, se dedica a la venta de frutas, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, lo que mas le gusta de Finca es el ahorro y las capacitaciones que le ayudan a poder tener mas noción de cómo hacer negocio y como invertir el dinero, aprendió a ser mas puntual y como hacer frente a las dificultades. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de frutas
texts.en: Alicia is a member of the Unión II (Union II) Communal Bank. She is 44 years old and she has 5 children. She sells fruits and she has been a member of Finca Peru for 3 years. What she likes the most about Finca are the savings and the seminars, thanks to which she can learn more about doing business and invest money. She has learned to be more punctual and to face difficulties. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy fruits.

loans.use: To buy fruits.

loans.name: Cristo El Salvador Group

texts.es: La Sra. María de 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo el cual aún es dependiente. Tiene más de 2 años con Edaprospo y pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Cristo el Salvador”. Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, negocio con el cual lleva 5 años y tiene el nombre de “Creaciones Estefano”, en honor a su pequeño hijo. Comenzó haciendo el servicio de costura para una empresa, con la idea de progresar y poder salir adelante. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo, ha logrado comprarse una maquina para continuar con su producción. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de alimentación y el colegio de su hijo, mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos de agua y luz. Ella piensa usar el reciente préstamo en la compra de materiales para su negocio. Su plan para el futuro es comprarse una casa y lograr que su hijo estudie una carrera superior. La antigüedad del grupo es de 2 años y medio y esta conformado por 7 personas.
texts.en: María is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child who is still dependent on her.  She has been with Edaprospo for more than two years and belongs to the 'Cristo el Salvador' (Christ the Savior) community bank.  She has been in business making clothing for five years.  Her business is called 'Creaciones Estefano' in honor of her young son.  She started out providing sewing services for another company with a view to making progress and getting ahead in life.  As a result of her efforts and hard work, she has managed to buy a machine so that she can continue making her products.  Right now her income is used to cover her family's food expenses and to pay for her son's education while her husband covers their water and electricity bills.  María is planning to use this loan to buy materials for her business.  Her plan for the future is to buy a house and ensure that her son studies for a degree.  This group is two and a half years old and has seven members.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru: Мукадас жительница города Кубодиен. Ей 34 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее муж занимается строительными работами, он строитель. Сама Мукадас занимается животноводством. Она в основном разводит крупнорогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности она занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Mukadas lives in the city of Qubadiyon. She is 34 years old, married, and has six children. Her husband works in construction, while Mukadas is engaged in animal husbandry. She mainly raises cattle and has been doing so for ten years. She is taking this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Sandra Batista De La Hoz

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva, sandra compró prendas de vestir, bolsos, calzado y papelería en general. En la actualidad planea un nuevo crédito, con el cual diversificará un poco mas su oferta para seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes,  invertirá ahora en utiles escolares, calzado y bisutería. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva: " Muchas gracias por apoyarme y confiar en mi, con la ayuda de ustedes tengo mejores ingresos y nuevos clientes. Sigan haciendo esa labor con las personas de menos recursos".
texts.en: Sandra used her previous Kiva loan to buy clothing, bags, footwear and stationery products.  She currently plans to take out a new loan so that she can diversify her stock a little more and thereby continue pleasing her customers.  She will invest this loan in buying school supplies, footwear and costume jewelry.  She sends the following message to Kiva lenders "Thank you very much for supporting me and placing your trust in me.  With your help I now have better income and new customers.  Please continue this work supporting people with fewer resources".

loans.use: to buy school supplies, footwear and costume jewelry

loans.name: Kwame Nkuruma Group

texts.en:
Khadija, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who go to school.  She has been a food vendor for two and a half years now.  She works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and to start selling powdered soap door to door, which helped with household expenses.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to increase the food stock and to buy a sack of powdered soap to resell.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kwame Nkuruma", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more food and a sack of powdered soap to resell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Although Marina continues with her business of selling children's clothes, she is currently focusing on developing her restaurant which she opened about four months ago. In her restaurant, Marina serves a lunch menu from 12 to 3 p.m. and dinner from 6 to 9 p.m. She says that her most popular dishes are plates featuring regional cuisine, especially quinoa and dried potatoes. Marina is married and supporting three children, two of whom are attending the local university, and a 13-year-old. 

At this time, Marina is requesting a loan to buy more tables for her restaurant, as well as to purchase cooking ingredients such as rice, sugar and oil. Marina would like to continue expanding her restaurant, and hopes to see all her children working as professionals. She is grateful for the loan, as her continued business success allows her to pay for the cost of university tuition and school supplies for her children.

Marina is a member of the village bank "Los Diamantes" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy tables and cooking ingredients such as rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Zakaria Magamedov

texts.en:
Zakaria is a 54-year-old farmer from a small village in the Kvareli District, East Georgia. Zakaria is married and lives with his wife, Leila, and two adult children (24 and 20 years old). All family members are involved in the family agricultural business, which is the only source of the income for them. In particular, the family has a farm with three milk cows, six calves and 47 goats. 

Zakaria and his wife produce various dairy products, mainly yogurt and cheese. They sell milk and other dairy products to local dairy products retailers. Along with the above mentioned, the family owns a greenhouse where cucumber is grown. Zakaria sells harvested products locally to retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 GEL. 

Zakaria requested credit for financing seasonal work in the greenhouse. In particular, he will purchase fertilizers and seeds for cucumbers. The remaining amount will be enough for purchasing two more calves. Zakaria will grow the calves and sell them after six months for higher price. It will give additional income to the family. Zakaria plans to use the increased income for renovation of the house, which is old and needs renovation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and calves.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 58 years old and married. She has five daughters and one son, who are now all working as professionals and living independently. She is the owner of a small grocery store where she sells staple goods such as rice, sugar, flour, milk and cookies. She has had this business for about three years and typically works from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM. Previously, she sold artisanal products around the streets of Cusco.

Carmen is asking for a loan to purchase more products for her grocery store, such as sugar, rice, vegetables and chicken. Carmen hopes to grow her business and eventually move to a larger storefront.

Carmen is a member of the village bank Los Diamantes in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery merchandise such as sugar, rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Katina Sarita

texts.es: Katina es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II, tiene 32 años, es madre de un niño, es dueña de un locutorio, a ella le encanta el ahorro, esta casada y su esposo ya terminó de estudiar Estomatología y ahora el proyecto que tiene es abrir un consultorio dental, este préstamo es para poder comprar una unidad dental.
texts.en: Katina is a member of the 'Unión II' community bank.  She is 32 years old and the mother of one child.  She owns a 'locutorio' (a business which provides telephone booths where people can pay to make calls).  She loves the savings.  Katina is married and her husband has just finished a degree in stomatology (a medical discipline involving the study of the mouth and its diseases).  Katina's current project is to open a dentist's office.  She will use this loan to buy a dental unit.

loans.use: to buy a dental unit

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old and lives with her partner. Recently, she started a new job as a primary school teacher leading a third grade class. Previously, she worked for the Ministry of Health in Peru which administers social security services.

Maria has been investing in her house over the past year, using prior Kiva loans in order to add a new layer of paint, buy new furniture and appliances, and make general improvements to the aging interior. She is very proud of her home and continues to invest in her property. 

Specifically, she would like to construct a studio in her home so that she and her partner can develop a business producing and selling melamine furniture (melamine is a plastic compound). With her loan, Maria plans to buy melamine for her furniture business, as well as home improvement materials such as iron, nails, tubes, cement and tiles. 

Maria hopes to complete construction of the furniture studio soon so that she can launch the business, and little by little save enough money to buy a car.

Maria is a member of the village bank "Los Diamantes" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy melamine and home improvement materials such as iron, cement, and tiles.

loans.name: Americo

texts.en:
Americo has dedicated about 18 years to working in transportation services. At various times, he has operated a taxi or heavy transit vehicle carrying freight or passengers. Currently, he is a taxi driver working seven days a week within the city of Cusco. He used to rent a car but was able to buy his own car in recent years, with help from prior Kiva loans. However, his vehicle will be 15 years old next year, at which time he must change vehicles to comply with local laws. 

Americo is requesting a loan in order to buy and renovate a used vehicle to continue operating his taxi business. He is 38 years old and lives with his partner and two daughters who are 4 and 14 years old. Americo takes great pride in his job and hopes that his continued success will allow him to continue maintaining his taxi in good condition. He plans routine maintenance every year. In five to six years' time, Americo says that he would like to change jobs and start a business in his house.

Americo is a member of "Los Diamantes" group in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan.

loans.use: to buy and renovate another vehicle to replace his current taxi.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is in her late 60s and married with eight children. Most of her children are now living independently, although two of them are university students studying accounting and nursing. Juana has been in the business of selling for many years. She used to sell food in the market, and at one time she sold firewood. 

Now she owns a small grocery store. She has been running the store in its current location for about 2-3 years. She looks after her store and usually wakes up at 5 in the morning to wait for fresh bread and clean up around the store. She makes her breakfast, opens the store, makes sure everything is in order and starts her day. She closes the store at 10 pm and on Sundays, she rests.

Juana is requesting a loan in order to buy grocery merchandise such as sugar, rice and oil. In the future, she hopes that her children will finish their studies and find good jobs. She is dedicated to her business and wishes to continue running her store and selling merchandise for as long as she is able.

Juana is a member of the village bank "Los Diamantes" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy grocery staples such as sugar, rice and oil.

loans.name: Cleofe Eufemia

texts.en:
Cleofe Eufemia and her husband run a business producing and selling caskets elaborated from wood. Together, they have owned this studio for about 10 years. 

With this loan, Cleofe Eufemia plans to purchase wood. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open a funerary home as well as a storefront to display and sell caskets to the public. 

Cleofe Eufemia and her husband are raising two children, ages 4 and 9. She has used prior Kiva loans to invest in tools for her husband’s carpentry work, among other activities.

Cleofe Eufemia is a member of the village bank "Los Diamantes" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy wood in order to produce caskets.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter owns a metal workshop, where he produces all sorts of metal products such as doors, roofs, windows and stairs. He is 31 years old and single and has been working in this trade for ten years. 

Walter is requesting a loan in order to purchase machinery such as a solder and a drill. Further into the future, Walter aspires to continue growing his business and add a rolling machine to his inventory of equipment, so that he can offer rolled iron products.

Walter is a member of the village bank "Los Diamantes" in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy machinery such as a metal solder and a drill.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 35 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow with one child. 

Gina has a snack and ice vending business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this work.  

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.
 
Gina has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Gina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los Arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana María, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo para ganarse la vida y el sustento diario, hace mas de 10 años y con sus pocos recursos que tenia puso en su casa una pequeña tienda de comestibles, la misma que empezó con muy poco y ahora gracias a los créditos ha podido ir aumentando y surtiendo con el paso de los días, en la actualidad además de víveres también vende útiles escolares y ciertos productos de bazar.  Trabajan todos los días  desde las  6h00 hasta las 20h00, en temporadas sus ventas aumentan mucho y en otras no tanto pero igual les produce algo para mantenerse ya que ellos ya están muy ancianos y es así como se ganan el sustento diario.

Este crédito lo quiere invertir en comprar más productos para aumentar su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, carnes, pescado y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener una tienda mucho más grande y salud sobre todo para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Nueva Generación' community bank meet in a place called Los Arenales, in Crucita parish, in Portoviejo canton.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

This is where we meet Ana María.  She is 63 years old, married, and has four children who are all now grown up and independent.  Her husband is a shopkeeper.

More than ten years ago, in order to earn a living and provide for their family on a daily basis, Ana María and her husband used a small amount of money they had to set up a small grocery store in their home.  They started out with very little but now, thanks to loans, they have been able to expand the business and, as time has gone by, they have also added school supplies and some homeware products.  Ana María and her husband work every day, from 6.00am to 8.00pm.  In some seasons their sales increase a lot but in others not so much.  However, all the same, it makes them enough to support themselves.  They are already elderly and this is how they provide for themselves.

Ana María would like to invest this loan in buying more products so that she can grow her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, meat, fish and other basic household products.  She has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it because of how easy it is to obtain loans.

Ana María's dreams are to have a much larger store and for herself and her family to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, meat, fish and other basic household products

loans.name: Margot

texts.en:
Margot has a shop where she sews and sells curtains made to order for her customers. Her clients include both institutions and individuals. She learned how to sew while growing up and has been making curtains for about 16 years now. She is 40 years old and is raising two children, 14 and 18 years old, with her partner. 

Margot would like a loan in order to purchase fabric and other materials to produce curtains. Her dream is to own a curtain factory and sell her products at wholesale.

Margot is a member of the village bank Los Diamantes in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make curtains.

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina is a 27-year-old biology student at the local university. Upon graduation, she would like to work at a research lab focusing on molecular biology. She says that she is fascinated by science because science holds the answers to many questions; for example, an understanding of DNA has solved many mysteries with respect to heredity and biological development. 

Karina is requesting a loan in order to buy a laptop to aid in her studies. Additionally, she will use part of the loan to help her mother who has a street cart where she sells candy and snacks. Karina hopes to eventually earn a master's degree in molecular biology. She has used her previous Kiva loans in order to invest in micro-businesses to finance her education.

Karina is a member of the village bank Los Diamantes in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for college and purchase sweets for a street cart.

loans.name: Edcie

texts.en:
Edcie is 40 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children.

Edcie has a store where she sells groceries and other items. She has operated this business for two years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her grocery store.

Edcie has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Edcie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods and products for her grocery store

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 40 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children.

Lilia has a grocery store where she sells groceries and other items. She has operated this business for three years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her grocery store.

Lilia became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Lilia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods and products for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Elezabeth

texts.en:
Elezabeth is 51 years old and lives in Centro Napu, Tudela. Elezabeth is married with five children.

To earn a living, Elezabeth has a business of selling fish in her local community. Elezabeth earns approximately 2,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Elezabeth is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

Elezabeth has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Elezabeth would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Lowell

texts.en:
Lowell is 29 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is married with no children or dependents.

Lowell has a coconut- and copra-buying/selling business. He typically earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to be used for purchasing additional coconuts and copra.

Lowell became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Lowell hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts and copra

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es: María Margarita, es  miembro del Grupo Solidario Las Marías, tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hija de cuatro años, su esposo es comerciante. María hace algunos años regreso de Estados Unidos de América y  trajo consigo algunos ahorros para iniciar un negocio y para poder comprar su casa, y con el poco  capital que tenia pudo iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de ropa  nueva y usada, su ventaja es que tiene muchos clientes y le va muy bien. El préstamo que María solicita lo invertirá en la compra de blusas, camisas y pantalones, sobretodo estilos que estén de moda, llamando la atención de sus clientes, de manera que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Uno de sus sueños era comprar una pequeña casa, la cual con mucho trabajo lo ha logrado junto con su esposo. Su meta es obtener su propio local y que sea un lugar amplio para poder tener su tienda de ropa. Es su primer crédito en FAMA y espera pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María Margarita is a member of the Las Marías communal bank.  She is 29 years old, married, and has a four year old daughter.  Her husband is a merchant.

Some years ago María returned from the United States.  She brought with her some savings to start a business and to be able to buy a house.  With the small amount of capital that she had she was able to start a small business selling clothes.  She currently devotes herself to selling new and used clothes.  Her advantage is that she has a lot of customers, and it is going very well for her.

María will use the loan that she is requesting to buy blouses, shirts, pants, and above all, styles that are in fashion.  This will get the attention of her customers, and she will then be able to increase her sales.  

One of her dreams was to buy a small house.  With a great deal of work she managed to do this together with her husband.  Her goal is to get her own place.  She wants the place to be large enough to be able to have a clothing store.

This is her first loan with Fama, and she plans on making her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is in her 50s, widowed and lives with her 24-year-old son. Esther has spent most of her life preparing tamales, a traditional Peruvian food made of corn meal wrapped in corn leaves. She makes both sweet and savory varieties, and sells her tamales in the street. 

Esther is requesting a loan in order to buy ingredients such as maize, sugar, and corn leaves. Her dream is to build up her savings and buy a plot of land. 

In the past, Esther has held other occupations, such as selling breakfast food and artisanal crafts.

Esther is a member of the village bank Los Diamantes in Cusco, which is receiving its 16th loan.

loans.use: to buy maize, sugar, and corn leaves to prepare tamales.

loans.name: Alicia Group

texts.en:
Alicia is 61 years old and lives in P-2 Pan-ay Diot, Tudela. Alicia is married with four children.

To earn a living, Alicia works in the fish industry by selling fish in her community. Alicia has been in this line of business for two years. Alicia is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional dried fish to sell to her customers.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her business.

Alicia is the leader of a four-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group operates her own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Marly

texts.en:
Marly is 40 years old and lives in Pob. 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Marly is married with four children.

To earn a living, Marly has a store where she sells a variety of products. Marly has operated this business for two years. Marly is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents, that she could then sell to her customers.

Marly has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Marly hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products (including canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents)

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 43 years old and lives in Pob. 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Wilma is single with three children.

To earn a living, Wilma has a store where she sells a variety of products. Wilma has operated this business for two years. Wilma is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, such as gasoline and firewood.

Wilma has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Wilma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell (including gasoline and firewood)

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II, tiene 44 años, es dueña de un Centro de Computo, ella es casada, ahora esta pasando por una etapa no tan buena económicamente, lo que esta tratando es de gastar en lo primordial, hasta que pueda pasar este tiempo, ella aprendió mucho en Finca como la forma de salir adelante a pesar de los obstáculos, las capacitaciones ayudaron mucho. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de tinta e insumos para recargar tonner.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Unión II communal bank.  She is 44 years old, and she is the owner of a computer center.  She is married.

She is now going through a difficult stage financially.  What she is trying to do is to spend on what is essential until she can get through this time.

She learned a lot in Finca.  She learned how to get ahead in spite of the obstacles, and the trainings helped a lot.

She will now use the loan to buy ink and supplies to refill toner.

loans.use: to buy ink and supplies to refill toner.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 42 years old and lives in P-2 Locsoon, Tudela. Dina is married with two children.

To earn a living, Dina works as a farmer by growing and selling vegetables. Dina has been doing this for two years. Dina is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers.

Dina has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Dina hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Russel Ann

texts.en:
Russel Ann is 32 years old and lives in Pob. 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Russel Ann is married with no children.

Russel Ann has a store where she sells variety of products. Russel Ann has operated this business for four years. Russel Ann is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to re-sell to her customers, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

Russel Ann has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Russel Ann hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to re-sell (including canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents)

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 36 years old and lives in Pob. 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Melchora is a widow with three children.

Melchora has a beauty parlor business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Melchora is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional beauty products.

Melchora has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Melchora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products

loans.name: Shukrani Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mujingwa, vice  représentante du groupe de crédit Shukrani, femme dynamique, ambitieuse, entrepreneur, âgée de 52 ans, mariée. Elle est  vendeuses des habits. Elle a commencé son business de lors qu’elle  fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour démarrer ses affaires.  Son mari est un pasteur  évangéliste serviteur dans une communauté protestante. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  3eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  une dizaine des boubous dames.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et ouvrir ses horizons pour s’approvisionner à Kampala.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client, Mujingwa, is vice representative of the Shukrani credit group. She is an entrepreneur, a dynamic woman, ambitious, 52 years old, and married. She sells clothing.

She began her business when she found out about the microcredit that was offered by the MFI, Hekima. Thus, she received her first loan of $50 to start up her business. Her husband is an evangelist pastor serving in a protestant community. The profits from her business go toward savings, food, and the education of her children.

Meanwhile, she has just received her third loan. Since receiving her first loan, Mujingwa's business has grown. So, she decided to increase the amount of her loan for this cycle. She will use this new loan to buy about ten female boubous. Also, she hopes to broaden her horizons and stock up in Kampala, as well as see her children grow up. The client would like to thank Hekima for helping to give autonomy to poor women who to not have access to classic banking.

loans.use: to buy about ten female boubous

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Elsa Mariflor

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los Arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Elsa, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos ya todos mayores de edad, pero el menor de ellos  aun vive con ella. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella tiene un negocio de compra y ventas de pinchaguas, esta es una variedad de pez muy solicitada por las personas y por los dueños de negocios de ceviches, ya que con este producto ellos preparan el delicioso ceviche de pinchaguas que es muy apreciado  por los clientes, ella compra a los pescadores en Los  Arenales, de allí se encarga de limpiar el pescado y curtirlas en  limón para luego entregarlas en tarrinas plásticas a sus clientes, trabaja todos los días en las mañanas tanto en la limpieza como en la entrega de sus productos, lleva más de cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad que le deja muy buenos ingresos.
