She has credit history so has once again decided to ask Integral for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy corn, cheese, fried pork, beans, etc.  Marta trusts that she will be able to give her family a better future and economic security for her home.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, fried pork skin and beans.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un pasteur. Elle a 3 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 12 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.
Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1994. Elle vend des pagnes et charbon de bois pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Afi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbon de bois et des pagnes. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait augmenter son fonds de roulement. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afi is a 39-years-old woman who is married to a pastor. She has three children, of whom two are in school. The first child is 12 years old, and the last, 2. 

Afi has been working as a retailer since 1994. She sells <i>pagnes<i/> (colorful West African cloth) and charcoal to all comers to her home. She purchases the goods in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her main difficulty is not being able to meet the demand fully. 

Afi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy sacks of charcoal and some <i>pagne<i/> cloth. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the next few years, Afi would like to increase her working capital. She says she plans on using the profits to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es: Erasmo de 28  años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar. El se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado de engorde. Con mucha dedicación mantiene  su ganado  en buenas condiciones los cuales vende una vez tengan el tamaño y peso adecuado. Es así como se  gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos. Él es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos   ya que con el tiempo ha sabido ganarse la confianza de muchas personas que cada vez lo prefieren mas. Su sueño es poder dar a su querida familia  mejores oportunidades de vida  a las que tienen ya que viven en condiciones muy humildes que no les permiten poder accesar a una mejor calidad de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de terneros de engorde para criarlos y ponerlos a la venta y poder mejorar sus ingresos que le permitan poder dar a su familia las condiciones adecuadas que conlleven a mejorar sus oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Erasmo, 28, lives in a house that’s his property with his family group.  He is a farmer and raises cattle to fatten up.  He keeps his cattle in good condition with much dedication and once they reach adequate size and weight he sells them.  This is how he earns his livelihood and provides daily bread for his home.  This activity is his main source of income.  

He is a very hardworking, responsible man who has good references from his neighbors since he’s managed to win over the trust of many people who prefer him more and more each time.  His dream is to be able to give his beloved family better life opportunities than they currently have since they live in very humble conditions that do not allow for access to a better quality of life.

He’s made the decision to ask Integral for this loan to buy calves to fatten up and raise in order to put them up for sale and be able to improve his income in order to provide his family with conditions that are adequate and bring with them better life opportunities.

loans.use: to buy calves to fatten up.

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr:
Fati est une femme âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur de friperie. Elle a 2 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier a 7 ans.
Fati travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend des fruits pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Fati a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des fruits. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Fati voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fati is a 32-years-old woman who is married to a vendor of used clothing. She has two children, who go to school. The first child is 10 years old, and the last, 7. 

Fati has been working as a retailer since 2004. She sells fruit to all comers at the market. She purchases the goods in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, her main difficulty is an inventory shortage. 

Fati has requested her third loan from WAGES to buy some fruit. She wants to reinvest in her business. 

In the next few years, Fati would like to expand her business. She says she plans on using the profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Akuegnon Group

texts.fr: AKUEGNON est un groupe composé de six personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe du nom de Salimatou Alakè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 42 ans. Salimatou Alakè est mariée à un transitaire du nom de Claude. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et qui est à leur charge. Salimatou Alakè vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Salimatou Alakè a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Salimatou Alakè mène comme activité la vente de produits congelés, de liqueurs, de canettes et des tissus de façon secondaire. Il y a trois ans que Salimatou Alakè exerce cette activité. Salimatou Alakè s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Salimatou Alakè sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKUEGNON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
AKUEGNON is a group composed of six persons who are friends. The group's representative, Salimatou Alakè (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 42 years old and married to a shipping agent by the name of Claude. They have one child who is in school and in their care. Salimatou Alakè lives together with her child and husband and jointly ensures with her husband that the household expenses are covered. 

Salimatou Alakè halted her studies in secondary school. To cope with her different expenses, she has a business selling frozen foods, liquor, canned soft drinks, and cloth secondarily. She has been in this business for three years. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

With the goal of responding better to the requirements of her burgeoning customer base and making more profit, Salimatou Alakè is requesting, along with the other members of the group AKUEGNON, an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods, liquor, and cloth.

loans.name: Vania Elizabeth

texts.es: Vania Elizabeth habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por sus abuelos, dos hijos y una sobrina. Ella se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos dentro de su  mini bazar el cual ha logrado establecer dentro de su hogar de residencia. Ofrece variedad de artículos tales como: cosméticos, prendas de vestir, juguetes, papelería, ropa para bebe, etc.  Es una mujer increíble la cual se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable y sobre todo emprendedora. Ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo para sacar adelante a su querida familia la cual cada día le demandan más.  Su negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos dado que es la única que trabaja para llevar el pan da cada día a la hogar. Para ella lo más importante es que su familia cuente con los recursos necesarios para sobrevivir. Todo esto es lo que la impulsa a seguir trabajando duramente para no descuidar su trabajo y seguir percibiendo los beneficio de su mini bazar, los cuales hasta el momento son los que han permitido llevar a su familia a flote. Cuenta con algunos clientes fijos que la prefieren por ser una mujer ejemplar, que con su carisma y duro trabajo ha sabido llevar a su familia y a su negocio adelante. Ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de artículos tales como: prendas de vestir, cosméticos, juguetes, etc. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL ya que  no cuenta con los ingresos necesarios para hacerlo por su cuenta. El objetivo es surtir su negocio de variedad de artículos que logren atraer a más clientes  que permitan aumentar las ventas e ingresos y pueda lograr el sueño de su vida de dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.  Vale la pena aclarar que está profundamente agradecida con INTEGRAL dado que en el pasado le brindaron la mano con otro préstamo que solicito para invertir en su negocio y que el mismo vaya creciendo.
texts.en:
Vania Elizabeth lives in a house that’s hers with her family group which is composed of her grandparents, two children and a niece.  She sells various products in her mini-store that she’s managed to set up at home.  She sells a variety of items like cosmetics, articles of clothing, shoes, stationery goods, baby clothes, etc.  

She is an incredible woman who stands out for being hardworking, responsible and above all enterprising.  She has worked for a long time to move her family, who daily demand more from her, forward.  Her business is her main source of income since she’s the only one that works to bring daily bread home.  For her, the most important thing is that her family has the necessary resources to survive.  This is what pushes her to continue working hard in order not to neglect her work and continue earning profits in her mini store which to date have been what’s allowed her to keep her family afloat.  She has some regular customers who prefer her because she’s an exemplary woman who has known how to support her family and move her business forward with her charisma and hard work.

She has decided to invest in her business buying a variety of things like: articles of clothing, cosmetics, toys, etc.  This is the reason why she’s asking Integral for a loan since she does not have the necessary income to do it on her own.  The objective is to stock her business with a variety of items that will attract more customers so that sales and income will increase and she can reach her dream of providing her family with better living conditions.

It’s worth stressing that she is profoundly grateful to Integral because they extended a hand to her previously with another loan she requested to invest in the business so that it can grow.

loans.use: to buy clothes, toys, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Felipe Antonio

texts.es: Felipe Antonio de 59 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos en especial maíz y frijoles.  De esta forma brinda lo necesario a su familia.  Después de cultivar la cosecha pone  a la venta cierta parte de los granos básicos y otra la deja para consumo de su familia.  Esta es su principal fuente de ingresos. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de él ya que a pesar de su avanzada edad sigue trabajando y no se cansa de hacerlo.  Cada día siente que las necesidades de su hogar son mayores por lo que ha decidido solicitar este préstamo a INTEGRAL  de tal manera que por medio de la ayuda de esta institución pueda comprar los insumos necesarios (semillas, abonos, venenos para plagas, etc.) para seguir cultivando los granos básicos que son los que le permiten dar a su familia el pan de cada día. Espera y confía en Dios todo poderoso que obtendrá resultados positivos y logrará su sueño de brindar a su querida familia mejores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Felipe Antonio, 59, lives in his own house with his spouse and four children.  He farms basic grains, corn and beans especially.  He provides his family with the basics this way.  After harvesting he sells part of the basic grains and leaves the rest for his family’s consumption.  This is his main source of income.  Many people give him good references.  Despite his advanced age he continues to work and does not tire to do so.  

Every day he feels that his home’s needs are greater so he’s decided to ask Integral for a loan so that through help from this institution he will be able to buy needed supplies (seeds, manure, bug killers, etc.) to continue farming basic grains which is what allows him to provide his family’s daily bread.  He hopes and trusts in God Almighty that he’ll obtain positive results and reach his dream of providing his beloved family with better economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, bug killers, etc.

loans.name: Kpemahuton 02 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement KPEMAHUTON 02 est composé de douze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Pauline est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Pauline n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pauline est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Pamphile. Le couple a six enfants, mais aucun n'est scolarisé. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Pauline vend depuis quinze ans, des ustensiles de cuisine par le système de distribution. Pauline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Pauline et les autres membres du groupement KPEMAHUTON 02 sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group "KPEMAHUTON 02" comprises twelve persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Pauline, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. With the goal of boosting their business to cope better with the demands of their customers, this group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé for the third time. 

Pauline never attended school. She is 43 years old and married to a man named Pamphile. They have six children, but none of the children are in school. To help with the diverse needs of her family, Pauline has been selling kitchen utensils for fifteen years via the distribution system. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering their business and further satisfying their customers, Pauline and the other members of the group KPEMAHUTON 02 are requesting a third loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to increase their level of business. The previous loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Noemy Esther

texts.es: Noemy Esther de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una tienda en el lugar de su residencia donde vende productos de primera necesidad frijoles, arroz, huevos, leche, azúcar entre otros, todo de primera calidad y a precios bajos además el servicio es inigualable; Noemy es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora se levanta desde muy temprano a atender su negocio pues no le gusta decepcionar a su clientela es por eso que se mantiene adelante de la competencia, piensa que al escalar una montaña muy alta, descubrirá que hay muchas más por alcanzar es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones etc. Noemy Esther tiene la confianza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y seguridad económica para el hogar.
texts.en: Noemy Esther is 39 and lives with her life partner and children.  She has a store located at home where she sells basic necessity products such as beans, rice, eggs, milk, sugar and others, everything she sells is of great quality, sold at low prices and the service is uncomparable; Noemy is an entreprenurial and hard working woman she gets up very early in the morning to work on her business because she doesn't like to dissapoint her clients and that's why she stays ahead of the competition.  She thinks that once a person gets to the top of a mountain they will discover that there are many more to climb; this is why she requests a loan to INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy basic grains, candy, products for instant preparation, drinks, soaps, etc.  Noemy Esther trusts that this way she will be able to provide for her family a better quality of life and financial security for her home.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, products for instant preparation, drinks, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es: Bertila habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar. Ella se dedica a la agricultura y comercialización de productos de la canasta básica como: maíz, frijoles, arroz, etc. es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora.  La señora Bertila habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su familia. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive lucha diariamente para sacar adelante a su familia y poder brindarles mejores condiciones de vida. Tiene muchos sueños y metas por cumplir. Uno de sus sueños es que su familia pueda tener mejores oportunidades de vida. Son ellas razones por las que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en los insumos necesarios (semillas, abonos, venenos para plagas, etc.) para el cultivo de los granos básicos que cada año cosecha, pone a la venta una parte de los mismos y otra la deja para consumo en su hogar. Es una mujer muy optimista y confía que Diosito estará de su parte para lograr su sueño.
texts.en:
Bertila lives in a house of her own with her family group.  She farms and sells basic staple items like corn, beans, rice, etc.  She is an enterprising, hardworking woman.

Bertila lives with her family in very humble conditions.  Despite the conditions she lives in she strives daily to support her family and be able to give them better living conditions.  She has many dreams and goals to reach.  One of her dreams is that her family has better life opportunities.

These are the reasons why she decided to ask Integral for a loan to buy needed supplies (seeds, manure, bug killers, etc.) for the basic grain crops she grows each year.  She sells part of the harvest and keeps the rest for her home consumption.  She’s a very optimistic woman and trusts that God will be on her side in order to make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, bug killers, etc.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura de 60 años de edad, habita  en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo. Sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y tienen sus propios hogares. Maura es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en cual consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para Maura lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad, razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza de muchos en la zona y a demás porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. El negocio está ubicado  frete de la escuela del lugar donde habita. Lugar donde tiene la mayoría de clientes. Ha decidido invertir en su negocio en la compra de artículos de tienda al por mayor, con el fin de atraer a más clientes que le permitan mejorar sus niveles de ventas e ingresos.  Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRLAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y de más productos atractivos para los clientes. Confía que de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maura, 60, lives with her husband in her own house.  Her children are all adults and have their own homes.  Maura is an enterprising, tenacious woman.  Some years ago she decided to open a small business consisting of a small store which with much dedication and effort she has managed to keep in operation over several years.  She has quite a few customers and they are what’s most important for Maura; she always tends to them with a smile and much kindness which is why she’s won over the trust of many in the area and also because she always has what they are looking for in stock.

Her store is located across from the local school which is where most of her customers come from.  She’s decided to invest in her store buying items for it at wholesale in order to attract more customers so that sales levels will increase.  Because of this she’s asked Integral for a loan to invest in her little store and stock it will all types of products like: rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, snacks, oil, paper, detergent and other products that are attractive to customers.  She trusts that she will be able to reach her dream of improving her living conditions this way.

loans.use: to buy stock inventory for her store.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana Mirian habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo. Ella se dedica a la comercialización de productos de tienda como son: granos básicos, golosinas, aceite, café, pan dulce y demás artículos que son atractivos para los clientes. Ha trabajado desde hace muchos años por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia en el área. Es muy conocida por muchas personas las cuales dan buenas referencias. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer responsable, trabajadora y sobre todo carismática ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de muchas personas. Su negocio es muy importante dado que es una de las fuentes principales de ingresos ya que  su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir todas las necesidades del hogar. Por tal razón es muy importante mantener su negocio en marcha. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de productos de tienda al por mayor tales como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, pan, azúcar, café, etc. Con fin de surtir su tiendita  para poder cubrir una mayor demanda de mercado. Espera lograr resultados favorables que le permitan accesar a mejores oportunidades económicas de tal forma que pueda vivir más tranquila y con mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana Mirian lives in her own home with her husband. She sells store products such as: basic grains, candies, oil, coffee, sweet bread and other items that most attract customers. She has worked for many years and has a lot of experience in this area. She is well known by a lot of people who give her good references. She is characterized as being a responsible woman who is hardworking and above all charismatic, since she has been able to gain the trust of many people. Her business is very important, since it is one of the main sources of income. Her husband is a farmer and what he makes isn't enough to cover all of the household necessities. For that reason, it is very important to keep her business going. She has made the decision to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in her business. She will buy store products wholesale such as: rice, beans, oil, candies, bread, coffee, etc. in order to stock her store and cover a bigger market demand. She hopes to achieve favorable results that will allow her to access better economic opportunities so she can live more calmly and with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, snacks, bread, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Velinda

texts.en:
Velinda is married with 3 children. Velinda is 22 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Velinda sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more different dried fish to sell.

Velinda became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Velinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ingrid Patricia

texts.es: Ingrid Patricia de 27  años de edad, vive en casa familiar junto con sus padres y su hermana. Ella  es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Ingrid  se dedica a la comercialización de productos de tienda como: bebidas, pan francés, macarrones, golosinas, condimentos, etc. El negocio está ubicado en su hogar de residencia el cual ha sabido adecuar de manera estratégica.  Es una mujer que con su amabilidad se gana la confianza de sus clientes y esto le ha ayudado a establecer un buen número de clientes fijos. Ella sueña con ver a su familia en mejores condiciones a las que ahora tiene, y es por esta razón que lucha día a día para mejorar de alguna manera su situación económica. Ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en variedad de artículos como: bebidas, golosinas, granos básicos, macarrones, aceite y de más artículos de tienda que le permitan atraer a más clientes que le lleven a aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Tiene gran confianza que con su trabajo y ayuda de Dios logrará su sueño.
texts.en:
Ingrid Patricia, 27, lives in the family home with her parents and her sister.  She is a hardworking, enterprising woman.  Ingrid sells general store items like: beverages, French bread, macaroons, snacks, condiments, etc.  The business is located at home and she’s learned how to set it up strategically.  She is a woman who wins over her customers’ trust with her kindness and this has helped her establish a good number of regular customers. She dreams with seeing her family in better conditions than what they have now and this is why she strives daily to somehow improve her economic situation.

She’s decided to ask Integral for a loan to buy a variety of items like: beverages, snacks, basic grains, macaroons, oil and other store items that will make it possible for her to attract more customers which will lead to increased sales and thus income.  She is quite sure that with her work and with God’s help she will reach her dream.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Horoldavaa

texts.en:
Horoldavaa is a 28-year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and his 2 children are 4 and 1 year old. He has been running a cellphone repair and spare parts retail business since 2005 in his town. He is one of the first retailers who started retailing the spare parts in that trade center. He has already made many regular customers in the area and succeeded in the field. He has a further plan to continue the business. 

Horoldavaa is a good-natured man who says that, "I would like to expand the business activity by buying some new equipment and program readers for the new cellphone technology." The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to purchase the new program readers and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase new program readers and equipment

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 61 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependents. 

Julia has a store that sells groceries. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

Julia has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, Julia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Nuria Carranza Guerrero

texts.es:
Doña Nuria es una mujer de 59 años de edad, casada pero separada años de su esposo, tiene siete hijos. Actualmente vive con una hija y dos nietos. Su vida ha sido muy dura, debido a que tuvo que trabajar y luchar sola para salir adelante con su familia. Ella se dedica a los servicios de comidas en una soda ubicada en un buen punto. Tiene una hija que le ayuda en los oficios domésticos y otra que trabaja con ella en la soda.
Es una clienta muy esforzada por lograr sus metas. Su objetivo es  aumentar sus ventas puesto que se le ha dificultado un poco por la falta de dinero para invertir más productos y el desempleo que se da en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Nuria, 59, is married but separated from her husband.  She has seven children and currently lives with a daughter and two grandchildren.  Her life has been hard because she had to work and struggle alone to get ahead with her family.  She sells prepared food at a well-located diner.  One of her daughters helps her with the housework and another works with her in the diner.
She is a client who makes a big effort to succeed with her goals and her objective is to increase her sales. It's been a little difficult because of lack of money to purchase more products and because of the unemployment in the city.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients

loans.name: Jeva Furigay

texts.en:
Jeva is from Barangay Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years of age, married, and has one school-aged child. Her husband is working abroad. 

She is in this business to help earn an income. To make a living, Jeva owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector specializing in selling a variety of products - mostly families' basic needs - in the community. Jeva had been in this business for 5 years and earns approximately 3,300 PHP per month. This is the primary source of income for Ms. Jeva. She came to the GDMPC office and applied for a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase supplementary grocery goods to sell. Jeva's revenue will be reinvested back to the business to double the return and a portion of the profit will be used for the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married with 2 children. Marilou is 35 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

Marilou sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Marilou has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to expand her area where she sells her snacks.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is married with three children. Librada is 43 years-old and lives in Dolipos Bajo, Oroquieta City.

Librada has a general store business and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan in the amount of Php 7,000 in order to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Librada has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for one year.  In the future, Librada hope to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Rosita De Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ROSITA DE LOS ANGELES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celia; ella es soltera y tiene 43 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de desayunos, ella prepara quinua con manzana, maca, leche entre otros desayunos, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 12:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los desayunos. La socia solicita el préstamo para refaccionar su casa y comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, yeso y arena.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de artículos de limpieza, negocio de venta de pollos, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de  venta de cosméticos, negocio de venta de desayunos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Rosita de Los Angeles Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.  The member’s name is Celia.  She is 43 years old, unmarried, and has two children.  She works in the business of selling breakfast.  She prepares quinoa con manzana (a typical dish made with whole grains and apples), maca (a native vegetable root of the radish family), milk, and other breakfast items.  She sells her meals on foot from 6:00 am to 12:00 noon.  Through this business, Celia gets her children ahead in life.  Her dream is to have a location where she can sell her breakfasts.  She is requesting this loan to repair her home and purchase construction materials such as cement, plaster, and sand.

The other members are in the business of selling cleaning products, chickens, cosmetics, and breakfast meals. Some members provide taxi services.
Celia is grateful to those who are a part of her dream by means of their participation in this program. She is committed to making her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, plaster, and sand for home repair.

loans.name: Lilia Martin

texts.en:
Lilia is 69 years-old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children. 

Lilia has a store that sells groceries.  She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 30,000 in order to purchase more stock for her general store.

Lilia has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for almost one year.  In the future, Lilia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is married with three children. Melly is 49 years-old and lives in Dela paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Melly is a farm owner and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase fertilizers and sprays for her rice production activity. 

Melly has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for almost eight years. In the future, Melly hopes to purchase additional parcels of rice land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and sprays for her rice production activity.

loans.name: Love Center Group

texts.en: Ma. Rebecca, 26 years old, is married and has 3 children. She lives in Danlugan, Pagadian City. She is a farmer who has been growing corn for the last four years to earn a living. Ma. Rebecca has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase farm supplies. She has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, she hopes to be a successful farmer who is able to pay her obligations well.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Waling-Waling Group

texts.en: Rosalina is a widow who has one child. She is 61 years old and lives in Sumadat, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. For the past 5 years, Rosalina has operated a business selling different kinds of food at the school canteen. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack sales business. Rosalina has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack sales business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
This is Catherine, 46, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her five children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Catherine operates a school supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies, like pens, bond paper, cartolina and the like, without going to a bookstore. She gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. She also sell accessories and personal items. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to purchase school supplies to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Catherine dreams to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of school supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a married woman with five children. Hilda is 35 years-old and lives in Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Hilda is operating a buy and sell barbecue foods business in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for the last three years.  

Each month, she earns 3,000.00 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 6,000.00 in order to purchase more goods to sell. In 2007, Hilda joined Kiva partner GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Hilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 35, is a resident of Taguig City, Philippines and the mother of two children. Her husband, Joery, is a driver. Nenita and her husband manage their household while operating a business. Nenita works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.  

Nenita operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Nenita earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Nenita earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Nenita is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nenita hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Leocio

texts.en: Leocio, 36 years old, lives in Happy Valley, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur. He is married and has 2 children. Leocio has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost one year. He has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more stock for his general store. Leocio hopes that someday he can earn a lot with his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his store

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa, 35, is a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Roland, her business partner, and a mother to their children. Elisa and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. Elisa works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Elisa operates a sales business. She buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells the items for a small profit. Her products are short pants, clothes and other similar products. Customers are attracted to the low prices and the many options Elisa offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Elisa earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Elisa is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan, which she will use to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elisa hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and ready-to-wear products

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en:
Amalya is engaged in the flower sales business. She rents a shop where she sells flowers, various house plants, candles, fancy boxes and bags and small souvenirs. Amalya arranges the flowers herself as she worked as a designer in the past. She buys her flowers from the neighboring city’s hothouses and her merchandise from Yerevan. Amalya always has many clients as her shop is situated in a very populous place near one of Sevan’s colleges.

Amalya, 22 years old, lives on her own in Sevan. She is a programmer but since she couldn’t find a job in Sevan, she decided to run her own business. Amalya is asking for a 150,000 AMD loan in order to buy beautiful landscape pictures, which she will sell in her large shop.

loans.use: To buy beautiful landscape pictures to resell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie, 37, has three children and lives in Manila, Philippines. She is married to Edwin, an employee. Melanie and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. Melanie works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Melanie retails processed meat products, such as ham, hot dogs, processed pork, etc. She buys the products from the wholesaler and then sells them per piece/pack for a profit. Customers are attracted to the low prices and the many options Melanie offers. She also retails cellphone loads for additional income. Melanie's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Melanie is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan, which she will use to buy more quantities and varieties of processed meat products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Melanie hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams of being able to give her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of processed meat products

loans.name: Ismaiil

texts.en:
Ismaiil is a 40-year-old married father of four children. Twelve years ago, he opened a grocery store, which is his family's main source of income. Ismaiil is a hard worker; he puts a lot of effort into improving his business to reflect positively on his family's social and financial situation and to ensure that he provides his children with the best education ever.

To improve his living conditions, Ismaiil has opened another business, a grain shop specializing in selling almost all kinds of grains. This business is highly requested in his area and recommended by most of his customers. Ismaiil is requesting a loan for the first time from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to support his newly started business, with special items and goods with special prices to ensure customer satisfaction and recommendations. He hopes to keep on improving his income to keep his family living happily.

loans.use: To buy special items and goods to support his newly started business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 48-year-old married father of three children. He has owned a bookstore for 31 years and his business is still going on just fine, almost covering most of his family's needs. Mohamad is a hard worker and is well known in his region, with his good reputation.

Mohamad has already had two loan cycles with Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua. His previous loan was invested in improving his business, and today Mohamad is applying for a new loan in order to increase his merchandise with special children's items for the spring and summer seasons. He will stock items such as coloring books, sea inflatables, games and many other entertaining items that will bring joy to the children during their Easter and summer vacations. This will also increase Mohamad's income and help in buying another car to replace the one that was stolen from him.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise with special children's items for the spring and summer seasons

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia, 28 years old, is from Iraq. She is a youth client who is married and has two children.

Nadia has been a tailor since 2006; she makes, repairs and alters clothing, such as suits, coats and dresses, for women. She has more than six years experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. Nadia has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

Nadia decided to apply for a loan of $1,100 in order to purchase a tailoring machine and more goods. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and more goods.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is married and has 4 children, 3 of them enrolled in school. Her husband, Ngata, is a farmer. Dama operates a farming business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for over 15 years and was previously employed as a cereals seller. Her primary customers are villagers. Dama describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality, Dama will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy cereals and sell them when the price hikes. Dama aspires to buy and sell cereals at wholesale in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds.	

Dama's highest monthly expenses are food and fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to purchase cereals for resale.

loans.name: Yanira Del Carmen

texts.es: Yanira del Carmen de 39 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con sus dos hijos. Ella se dedica al negocio de peluquería que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado establecer y mantener en marcha por mucho tiempo. Cuenta con muy buenas referencia y gracias a su arduo trabajo ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas que cada vez la prefieren más, por ser una mujer, trabajadora, luchadora y sobre todo carismática. Su sueño es poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida en especial a sus queridos hijos que por el momento se encuentran estudiando. No pierde las esperanzas de poder darles el estudio y lograr verlos como grandes profesionales ya que es la única forma de poder brindar estabilidad y mejores condiciones de vida. Ha decidido solicitar este crédito a  INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeña peluquería en la compra de espejos e  invertir en la reparación de los sillones que por el uso están deteriorados. Su objetivo es mejorar el servicio a los clientes para que estos se sientan motivados a querer regresar en el futuro y puedan invitar a otros clientes,  de tal forma que esto sirva para mejorar los  ingresos que le permitan accesar  a mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Yanira del Carmen, 39, lives with her two children in a house that’s her property.  Her business is a barber shop which with much effort and dedication she’s managed to establish and keep operating for a long time.  She has very good references and thanks to her hard work has won over the trust of many people who prefer her more each day because she’s a hardworking, tenacious and above all, charismatic woman.  

Her dream is to be able to give her family better living conditions especially to her beloved children who are currently attending school.  She does not lose hope of being able to provide schooling for them and to see them become great professionals since this is the only way of offering them stability and better living conditions.

She has decided to ask Integral for this loan to invest in her small barber shop.  She will buy mirrors and invest in chair repair because they are in poor condition.  Her goal is to improve customer service so that they will feel motivated to want to return in the future and they can invite other customers so that her income will improve in order to access better economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy mirrors and to invest in chair repair.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario Alberto de 50 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por su esposa y sus dos hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como maíz y frijoles. De esta forma se gana la vida y es como logra llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Es su principal fuente ingresos, dado que una vez saca la cosecha del año, la vende para poder sacar los ingresos que le permitan cubrir las principales  necesarias del hogar. Para él es muy importante su familia. Lo que más desea es poder ayudarle a salir adelante,  principalmente a sus hijos que son su principal inspiración. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y fungicidas para su cultivo, todo esto con el fin de obtener una buena cosecha que le permita mejorar sus ingresos y por consecuencia su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto, 50, lives in a house of his own with his family which is composed of his wife and two children.  He farms basic grains like corn and beans.  This is how he earns his livelihood and how he manages to provide daily bread for his home.  It’s his main source of income since once he gathers the yearly harvest he sells it to earn income to cover the home’s main expenses.  For him, his family is very important.  What he wants most is to help them get ahead, especially his children who are his greatest inspiration.

He’s decided to ask Integral for a loan to buy fertilizer and fungicide for his crops so that he can get a good harvest that will make it possible for him to improve his income and consequently his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicide.

loans.name: Afepeb Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AFEPEB est composé de douze personnes qui mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus et habitent le même village. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Bérengère Germaine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Bérengère Germaine est âgée de 54 ans et n'est pas encore mariée. Bérengère Germaine n'a pas non plus d'enfant. Bérengère Germaine assure donc seule ses différentes charges. Pour y parvenir, Bérengère Germaine mène comme activité, la vente de chaussures, de tissus et de sacs à son domicile. Bérengère Germaine exerce cette activité depuis trois ans et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Bérengère Germaine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement AFEPEB, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group AFEPEB comprises twelve persons who all have revenue-generating businesses and who live in the same village. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their businesses. 

The group's representative, Bérengère Germaine, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 54 years old and is not yet married. Neither does she have any children. So she supports herself alone. To do so, she has a business selling shoes, cloth, and handbags out of her home. She has been in this business for three years and gets her supplies from Lomé, the capital of Togo. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Bérengère Germaine, along with the other members of the group AFEPEB, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé

loans.use: to buy shoes, handbags, and cloth

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar. Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos especialmente maíz y frijoles. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia en el área. Sus vecinos dan buenas referencias de él puesto que con su amabilidad, honestidad y trabajo ha sabido ganarse la confianza de  muchas personas. Para él lo más importante es que su familia cuente con lo necesario para sobrevivir.  El señor Mariano no se cansa de trabajar, para él su familia es su principal inspiración y es por ella que día  a día se levanta muy temprano para poder cultivar la tierra y poder cosechar los granos básicos que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir  en los insumos necesarios (semilla, venenos para plagas, abonos, etc.) para él cultivo de los granos básicos que año con año cosecha. Espera y confía en Dios que logrará  resultados favorables que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
Mariano lives in a house that’s his with his family.  He farms basic grains, especially corn and beans.  He’s been in this line of work for a long time so he has much experience in this field.  His neighbors give him good references because he’s managed to win over the trust of many with his kindness, honesty and work.  For him, what is most important is that his family has everything necessary to survive.  

Mariano does not tire of working.  For him, his family is his main inspiration and it’s for them that he rises early every day to be able to farm the land and harvest basic grains that are his main source of income.

He’s decided to ask Integral for this loan to buy necessary supplies (seeds, bug killers, manure, etc.) for his basic grain crops that he harvests year by year.  He hopes and trusts in God that he’ll obtain favorable results that will allow him to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bug killers, manure, etc.

loans.name: Luz De María

texts.es: Luz de María de 49 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella se dedica a la comercialización de productos herbalife los cuales son productos nutricionales y de cuidado personal. Tiene 9 años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia en el área y con varios clientes fijos. Con mucho trabajo y dedicación  se ha ganado la confianza de muchas personas las cuales cada día la prefieren más por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable y carismática. Ella ofrece variedad de productos nutricionales como vitaminas, suplementos alimenticios, etc. a muy buenos precios.  Ella trabaja duramente para sacar adelante a su querida familia. La situación económica es muy inestable y las preocupaciones de Luz aumentan muy rápido dado que las exigencias de su familia cada vez son mayores. Debido a lo anterior a tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la comprar de productos nutricionales como son: vitaminas y suplementos alimenticios, entre otros. De tal forma que esto ayude a atraer a más clientes que generen un aumento en las ventas y en los ingresos que permitan mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Luz de María, 49, lives in a house that’s hers with her family composed of her husband and three children.  She sells Herbalife products which are nutritional and personal care products. She’s been in this line of work for 9 years so she has much experience in this occupation and several regular customers.  With much work and dedication she’s won over the trust of many people who prefer her day by day for being an enterprising, responsible and charismatic woman.

She sells a variety of nutritional products like vitamins, nutritional supplements, etc. at very good prices.  She works hard to support her beloved family.  The economic situation is very unstable and Luz’s worries increase very rapidly because her family’s needs are greater every day.

Because of the above, Luz has decided to ask Integral for a loan to invest in her business buying nutritional products like vitamins and nutritional supplements among others so that she can attract more customers that will generate sales and income increases  that will allow her to improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, nutritional supplements, etc.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 145 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO 145 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Safouratou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Safouratou est âgée de 43 ans et vit au Bénin. Safouratou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Safouratou est mariée à un certain Pascal. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Safouratou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec lui les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges, Safouratou vend du maïs et du tissus dans une région du Bénin. Safouratou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Safouratou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 145, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The GBENONKPO 145 group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The is the fourth time that this group has asked ALIDé for financial help, in order to increase their level of activity. The group's representative, Safouratou, has her hand raised in the photo. Safouratou is 43 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school. She is married to a man named Pascal. The couple has four children, all of whom go to school and are in their care. Safouratou lives with her husband and children. She and her husband are both responsible for meeting the household's various expenses. 

In order to meet her expenses, Safouratou sells corn and fabric in a region of Benin. She obtains her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase turnover and revenue, Safouratou and the other GBENONKPO 145 members are asking ALIDé for a fourth loan. The previous loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sacks of corn.

loans.name: Blanca Yaneth

texts.es: Blanca Yaneth habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo él cual se dedica a la agricultura. Ella se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir.  El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Blanca es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios (telas, hilos, elástico, etc.) para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca Yaneth lives in a house that’s hers with her husband who is a farmer.  She makes articles of clothing to sell.  The business is located in her house.  Blanca is an incredible, very exemplary woman who is very hardworking, responsible and positive.  Besides, many people give her good personal and work references. 

She makes a variety of clothing items at very accessible prices.  She also offers quality in her work which is why many people prefer her.  She’s been in this line of work for many years so has quite a bit of experience in it and above all regular customers who prefer her more each day.

She’s decided to ask Integral for this loan to invest in her small business buying necessary supplies (fabric, thread, elastic, etc.) to make a variety of articles of clothing.  She does all this aiming at providing better customers service so that her customers will feel motivated to continue requesting her service and her sales and income will increase.  She hopes to reach her objective and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: María Griselda

texts.es: María Griselda habita en casa de su propiedad junto con sus tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando.  Ella es una mujer ejemplar la cual trabaja duramente para sacar adelante a su querida familia. Hace muchos años y gracias a muchos esfuerzos ha logrado establecer una  pequeña tienda en la cual ofrece todo tipo de producto de primera necesidad como: granos básicos, detergente, golosinas, pan dulce, etc.  María  es una mujer emprendedora y gracias a su creatividad  ha logrado mantener activo su negocio. Ella no se rinde,  quiere mejorar su servicio y hacer que su negocio crezca cada día más. Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para cumplir su sueño y mejorar el servicio que ofrece y al mismo tiempo mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia. Con el crédito espera comprar variedad de artículos de tienda como: arroz, maíz, frijoles, azúcar, pan dulce, golosinas, etc. Confía en Dios que los resultados serán favorables.
texts.en:
María Griselda lives in her own house with her three children who are attending school.  She’s an exemplary woman who works hard to support her beloved family.  Many years ago and thanks to much effort she was able to open a small store where she offers all types of basic staple items like: basic grains, detergent, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

María is an enterprising woman and thanks to her creativity has managed to maintain her business active.  She does not give up and wants to improve service and make her business grow more every day.

Because of this she’s decided to ask Integral for a loan to reach her dream and improve service while at the same time improving her and her family’s living condition. 

She expects to use the loan to buy a variety of goods like: rice, beans, corn, sugar, sweet bread, snacks, etc.  She trusts in God that results will be favorable.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, beans, sugar, sweet bread, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Salem De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Micheline est la coordonatrice de son groupe SALEM DE OUANAMINTHE, la ville de OUANAMINTHE d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle est  mariée elle a des enfants. Micheline a dirigé son business pendant les 10 dernières années avant de commencer ce commerce, Elle  etait a l’ecole.

Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des vetements uses. Micheline espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Les  autres membres Salem ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et des vetements uses.

Micheline dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmentation du business. Son rêve est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les marchandises.
texts.en:
Micheline is the coordinator of her group SALEM DE OUANAMINTHE, the city of OUANAMINTHE, in Haiti where electricity is rare and water is in short supply. Micheline is married and has children. She has run a business for the last ten years before starting this business. She has been to school. 

Micheline would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of used clothing. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business. The other members of SALEM have need of a loan for such businesses as selling charcoal, rice, and used clothing. 

Micheline says that her main challenge is a lack of constant customers and that her main goals include growing her business. Her dream is to buy a truck to transport merchandise.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Felipa Rivera Pérez

texts.es: Doña Felipa es una clienta con 43 años de edad, casada y con tres hijos. Vive con su esposo y una hija. Humilde y muy trabajadora. Tiene trayectoria en la Fundación y siempre se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad y responsabilidad. Ella se dedica al comercio ambulante de oro, perfumes finos y cortinas. Además tiene un salón de belleza en donde presta los servicios de químicos para el cabello y estética. Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y trabajadores de diferentes bananeras aledañas a su comunidad. Ella se organiza días específicos para salir a vender su mercadería y poder atender también a sus clientas del salón. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y una hija para el cobro de su mercadería. Ha tenido dificultad en su negocio por la falta de capital para poder ofrecer mayor variedad y ahora lo supera por el financiamiento que se le otorga.
texts.en:
Felipa, 43, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and a daughter.  She is humble and very hardworking.  She has history with the Fundación and has always been noted for her punctuality and responsibility.  

She is an ambulatory gold, fine perfume and curtains merchant.  She also has a beauty salon where she provides chemical hair treatments and beauty services.  Her customers are neighbors, family members and laborers from nearby banana plantations. 

She organizes specific days to go out selling her merchandise while also being able to tend to her salon customers.  Her husband and daughter help her collect payment for her merchandise.  She’s had some difficulty in the business because of lack of capital to be able to offer a wider selection but she hopes the loan she will get now will help her overcome this.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like gold and others.

loans.name: Betty Edme Cahuana Pino

texts.es:
Betty es una mujer que tiene un pequeño de 14 años, por el que siempre lucha y está a dispuesta a dar algo más de sí con la finalidad de cuidarlo y apoyarlo en todo lo que necesite. Ella es una mujer que culminando el colegio deseó poder inscribirse y estudiar para convertirse en secretaria, pero debido a muchos motivos ella, ni su familia tuvieron la capacidad económica para cumplirle este deseo y necesidad académica. Es así como esta historia de lucha empieza, una mujer que decidida y dispuesta a dar lo mejor de sí, empezó a iniciarse en el comercio.

Betty se dedica a realizar la venta de pan, en una avenida muy concurrida de la ciudad de Ica. Ella se levanta muy temprano diariamente para así poder comprar todo el pan que venderá en la mañana, Betty trabaja un promedio de 6 horas. Ella ya tiene muchos años en este negocio y con el tiempo ha logrado hacerse conocida en la zona en donde vive. Decidió tomar esta decisión y convertirse en una gran microempresaria, meta que actualmente viene cumpliendo.

Después de tanto tiempo, ella ha detectado que algunos de sus clientes tienen la necesidad de desayunar en el mismo lugar, es por ello que ha decidido realizar la compra de sillas y mesas con la finalidad de vender desayunos y así incrementar la cantidad de sus clientes y por ende sus ingresos. Es por este motivo que ha recurrido al apoyo de los prestatarios Kiva, ya que actualmente no tiene el dinero suficiente para realizar la compra de todos estos accesorios.
texts.en:
Betty is a woman who has a 14-year-old son she strives for always and is willing to give all she has in order to care for him and support him in everything he needs.  She’s a woman who upon completing secondary school wanted to be able to enroll to study and become a secretary but due to many reasons neither she nor her family had the economic wherewithal to make this dream and academic need come true.  This is how this history of struggle starts, a woman who is determined and willing to give her best begins to start off in commerce.

Betty decides to go into bread sales on a very busy avenue in the city of Ica.  She rises very early every day to be able to buy all the bread she’ll sell in the morning.  Betty works on average 6 hours.  She has been in this business many years and in time has managed to become well-known in the zone where she lives.  She decided to make this choice and become a great micro businesswoman, a goal she’s currently reaching.

After all this time, she’s detected that some of her customers would like to have breakfast in the same place so she’s decided to buy some tables and chairs with the goal of selling breakfasts to increase the number of her customers and thus her income.  This is why she’s calling on support from Kiva lenders because she does not have sufficient money to buy all these accessories at present.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her new business.

loans.name: Abiyemejumurimo/kmg Group

texts.fr:
Jacques fait partie du groupe Abiyemejumurimo/Kmg. Il a 51 ans, il est marie avec 7 enfants de 5 ans à 25 ans, dont 4 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 4 ans de primaire.

Jacques est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de solliciter d’autre crédit pour développer son business. Dans les prochaines années, Jacques voudrait être un grand cultivateur des riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jacques is part of the group Abiyemejumurimo/Kmg. He is 51 years old. He is married and has seven children, from 5 to 25 years old. Four of the children are in school. He has a 4th grade education.
 
Jacques is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his first one with the microfinance institution ACB. His going to use his loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor. 

His strategy for the growth of his business is to request another loan for developing his business. In the next few years, he would like to be a major rice farmer in his region. With the profit, he plans on providing schooling for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Edgar David Aguirre Bravo

texts.es:
Edgar es un hombre soltero que tiene todos los ánimos de salir adelante y progresar continuamente para así lograr convertirse en un gran microempresa. Actualmente vive en la ciudad de Ica, lugar que con el transcurso del tiempo ha mejorado económicamente y le da la bienvenida a los nuevos microempresarios.

Edgar es un joven que se dedica a realizar el servicio de decorado para eventos, el se está haciendo muy conocido en la zona por donde vive y también lo están recomendando para otros distritos de la ciudad de Ica, debido a lo satisfechos que quedan sus clientes.

Él trabaja aproximadamente 12 horas a la semana donde tiene que pensar los colores que combinará, el diseño de la decoración, entre otros  factores. Es gracias a sus padres que él se animo a convertirse en un gran decorador. Edgar también trabaja en una empresa de transporte como ayudante, lo que le permite tener ingresos mientras no se dedica a la decoración.

Edgar desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan apoyarlo para poder alquilar un pequeño local donde guardar todos sus implementos de decoración, debido a que actualmente se encuentran en su casa y ocupan demasiado espacio. Con esta ayuda podrá consolidar su negocio, mejorar sus ingresos y desde luego lograr el sueño de la casa propia.
texts.en:
Edgar is a single man who is very motivated to get ahead and make constant progress in order to become a great micro business.  He currently lives in the city of Ica, a place that has improved economically with the passage of time and that welcomes new micro businessmen.

Edgar is a young man who provides event decoration services.  He’s becoming very well known in the area where he lives and he’s also being recommended in other districts in Ica by his satisfied customers.

He works approximately 12 hours per week thinking about the colors he’ll have to combine, the design of the decoration among other factors.  Thanks to his parents he ventured forth to become a great decorator.  Edgar also works for a transportation firm as an assistant which allows him to earn income while he’s not doing decorations.

Edgar hopes that Kiva lenders will be able to support his so that he can rent a small locale where he can store all his decoration supplies because they are currently at home and they take up too much space.  With this help he will be able to consolidate the business, improve his income and, of course, reach his dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to rent a small locale to store his materials.

loans.name: Tuzamure Rubanda Rugufi Group

texts.fr:
Alodie fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane Rubanda Rugufi. Elle a 38 ans, elle est marie avec 1 enfants de 17 dont 1 scolarises. Elle a 1 personne dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Alodie est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de solliciter d’autre crédit pour renforcer son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Alodie voudrait devenir une meilleure dans son  agricultrice. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de scolariser et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Alodie is part of the group Tuzamurane Rubanda Rugufi. She is 38 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 17, who is in school. She has one person aside from her own child to support. She has three years of middle school education.
 
Alodie is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is her first one with the microfinance institution ACB. She is going to use his loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor. 

Her strategy for the growth of her business is to request another loan for bolstering her farming. In the next few years, she would like to be one of the best in rice farming. With the profit, she plans on providing schooling for the children and taking care of them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Aurelia Feliciana

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene 64 años de edad, pero se considera una joven de 20 años porque es muy entusiasta y sobre todo carismática, vive junto a su esposo y su hija a la que quiere mucho, aun mas porque ya es abuela de una preciosa nieta, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad conocida por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, así como también porque ahí se encuentra la mayor parte de la descendencia afroperuana; asimismo es la ciudad donde se preparan platillos muy ricos, gracias a que sus pobladores tienen un don para la cocina. Aurelia disfruta de su tiempo libre paseando con su nieta, la cual es su adoración, asimismo gracias a su habilidad para la cocina le gusta preparar uno de sus platilos favoritos el cual es “Arroz con pato y Carapulcra”; ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar medicina.

Todos los días Aurelia sale a trabajar en su negocio de venta de hamburguesas y salchipollo, trabaja alrededor de 6 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 60 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque brinda una buena atención a sus clientes y atiende hasta tarde lo que le permite tener un poco mas de clientes asi como también tiene buena sazón para la preparación de sus productos.

Aurelia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar, mas ingredientes para la elaboración de sus productos al por mayor , en especial ingredientes como papa, carne, pollo, pan, embutidos entre otros, ya que le ayudara a ahorrar un poco más en los ingredientes y mejorar sus ingresos, asi seguirá trabajando día a día para comprarse un carrito sanguchero nuevo y luchar para realizar su gran sueño:”  Construir su casa ya que esta se derrumbo cuando ocurrió el terremoto del año 2007 y sobre todo apoyar a su nieta con sus estudios”.
texts.en:
Aurelia is 64 years old but she thinks of herself as a young 20-year-old because she’s very enthusiastic and above all charismatic.  She lives with her husband and daughter who she loves very much all the more so because she’s now a grandmother of a beautiful granddaughter.  

Her house is located in the city of Chincha, a city known for being the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes as well as because most of the Afro-Peruvian descendents are here.  It’s also a city where delicious meals are prepared thanks to the residents having a gift for cooking.  Aurelia enjoys her free time very much taking her granddaughter for walks; she is her adoration.  Also, thanks to her cooking ability she likes to make one of her favorite dishes which is ‘Arroz con Pato y Carapulcra.” She only went to secondary school but would have liked to study medicine.

Every day Aurelia goes out to work selling hamburgers and “salchipollo” [fried potatoes with fried chicken].  She works about 6 hours per day and can see up to 60 customers per day.  She believes that she does well in her business because she provides good customer service and is open late which allows her to have a few more customers and also because she prepares her dishes in a very tasty way.
