Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées et des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Djumapiri voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Djumapiri is part of the group Indatwa B /Bgrm NO 14. He is 63 years old. He is married and has eight children, from 12 to 30 years old. Six of the children are in school. He has a 5th grade education. 

Djumapiri is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his first one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor. 

His strategy for the growth of this business is to use select seeds and some fertilizers for his rice farming. In the next few years, he would like to be the No. 1 farmer in his region. With the profits, he plans on providing schooling to his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхом житель города Истаравшан. Ему 50 лет. Он жена. У него двое детей. Он занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он занимается торговлей женской верхней одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Ihom is a resident of Istaravshan.  He is 50 years old, married and has two children.  He is involved in sales.  Ilhom has a store, where he sells women's outerwear.  He has been in this business for 20 years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 36-year-old married man. He has a son who is three years old. He describes himself to be self-reliant. He operates a motor vehicle to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs two people. His business is located in a busy town and his primary customers are from the general public. His biggest business challenge is stiff competition within the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy motor vehicle spare parts. His business goal is to be a well-established transport provider within five years.

loans.use: to buy more motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old and married with three children.

Adel has owned his shop since 1997, where he sells clothing and accessories for women. He has experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers. He has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to renovate and redecorate his shop. He hopes to earn more profits to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Sophia's Group

texts.en:
Sophia is 17 years old and she lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past year, she has been working hard to manage her business, which is selling clothes. She is a member of a loan group comprised of two hardworking women. 

Sophia is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to purchase more clothes to sell and help expand her business. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and pay her own school fees. Sophia hopes that in the future she will be able to build a shopping mall of her own. 

Sophia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sophia's future prospects.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
This borrower is Saad from Iraq. He is 48 years old and is married with four children. Saad is a mechanic who opened his own car workshop in 2005.  He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local customers. Saad knows about his customer's needs and is well-known in the surrounding areas. He has a good reputation. 

Saad is requesting a 2,700 USD loan to purchase a hydraulic press. His aim is to gain more profits to provide him with the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a hydralic press

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 23 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Norah has been working hard to manage her bar where she sells drinks. 

Norah is requesting a 500,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to help expand her business and buy more drinks, like beer, to sell. Her loan will help Norah generate greater profits. She hopes to start a side-business of selling charcoal. 

Norah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Norah's future prospects.

loans.use: to buy drinks, like beer, to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is Ali from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 24 years old and married with two children. Since 2010, Ali has owned an upholstery workshop where he works repairing old furniture, especially seats, with padding, fabric or leather covers. He gained good experience in this field from his family. Ali has a deep understanding of local customers and he knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in surrounding areas.

Ali is requesting a 2,400 USD loan to make shelves and showcases for his workshop. His aim is to increase his profits to have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make shelves and showcases for his workshop

loans.name: Wilfride

texts.fr:
CLIENTE ÂGÉE DE 41ANS, MARIÉE MÈRE DE 6 ENFANTS DONT L’AGE VARIE  ENTRE 4 ANS  ET 23 ANS.
A L'ARRÊT DE SES ÉTUDES EN CLASSE DE TROISIÈME, ELLE SE LANCE DANS LE COMMERCE  EN OUVRANT UNE BOUTIQUE D’ALIMENTATION EN OCTOBRE 2011.

SES RECETTES JOURNALIERS SONT DE 15000F A 45.000 FR PAR JOUR ET ELLE RÉALISE LES BÉNÉFICES QUI LUI PERMET DE FAIRE LES ACHATS SUPPLÉMENTAIRES.

AVEC CE  PRÊT, ELLE VA ACHETER : 5 CARTIONS  DE JUS EN BOITES (FANTA, COCA COLA, SPRIT) ,2 CARTONS DE SPAGHETTI, 2 CARTONS DE SARDINES  HUILE, 3 CARTONS DE LAIT EN BOÎTE EN POUDRE ET CONCENTRE, 2CARTONS DE DÉTERGENTS, 3 CARTONS DE SAVON DE LESSIVE ET TOILETTE.
SON ALIMENTATION EST CONNUE CAR ELLE OUVRE TÔT ET FERME TARD, ELLE RENOUVELLE SON STOCK RÉGULIÈREMENT POUR NE PAS FAIRE LA RUPTURE DE STOCK.

SON BUT EST DE VENDRE BEAUCOUP AFIN DE FAIRE DES BÉNÉFICES ET ÉLARGIR SON ALIMENTATION, EN MÈRE DE FAMILLE, ELLE CONTRIBUE AUSSI A  l’EDUCATION DE SES ENFANTS.
texts.en:
This client is 41 years old, married, and the mother of six children, from 4 to 23 years old. Upon dropping out of middle school, she got started in commerce by opening a grocery store in October 2011. 

Her daily receipts amount to 15,000 to 45,000 francs a day, and she makes a profit enabling her make extra purchases. 

With this loan, she is going to buy: 5 boxes of canned drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite), 2 boxes of spaghetti, 2 boxes of sardines in oil, 3 boxes of canned powdered milk and concentrated milk, 2 boxes of detergents, 3 boxes of laundry soap and bath soap. 

Her grocery store is known for opening early and closing late. She renews her inventory regularly, so as not to be short of stock. 

Her goal is to sell a lot in order to make a profit and to expand her store. As a mother with a family, she also helps to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy boxes of canned juices, spaghetti, soaps, detergents, canned sardines, and canned milk powder.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprarse alimento para el ganado, pues en esta época los pastos están secos, por lo que deben recurrir a la compra de concentrado, zacate picado, pago de mano de obra  para transportar el alimento.
Él considera que él préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho, comprándose ganado y alimento, le ha permitido estar en pie en su actividad ganadera, para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Elías has decided to apply for a new loan, in order to buy feed for his cattle. This is because at this time of year the pastures are dry, so he has to resort to buying concentrated feed and chopped grasses, and pay for labor to transport the feed.

He considers that the previous loan helped him a great deal, as buying cattle and feed has allowed him to keep his cattle business going and support his family.

loans.use: To buy concentrated feed, chopped grasses, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Avtandil Okropiridze

texts.en:
Avtandil is 47 years old. He lives in a small village in the Gori District with his family: his wife, Eka, his 18-year-old daughter, his 17-year-old son and his mother. Avtandil’s daughter is a student. His son goes to school. 

The family earns a living through their agricultural business. They have a dairy farm with two milk cows and four calves. Eka produces cheese and sells it locally to dairy product retailers. Along with the dairy farm, the family owns 4.5 hectares, on which Avtandil and Eka grow garlic, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, maize, peaches, apples and pears. In spring and summer, Avtandil and Eka spend their days working their land. They sell harvested fruits and vegetables in the village to greengrocery wholesalers. 

Avtandil requested credit for financing his seasonal works. In particular, he will hire a tractor till the land, and purchase fertilizers and pesticides to protect the plants from parasites. They expect that the family will get a good harvest in summer/fall and sell it for good price. The family use the income during the year to finance their daily expenses. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the family farm.

loans.use: to pay for land-tilling service and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides against parasites.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, and married with two children.

Ali has owned a shop since 2009, selling electronic games and CDs. He has experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to renovate and redecorate his shop. He hopes to earn more profits to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a 48-year-old married woman. She has five children. Her husband's name is Swaleh and he is employed. Mwanarusi operates a food business and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are villagers. 
Her greatest business challenge is seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanarusi will use the Kes 5,000 loan to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. Mwanarusi aspires to open a restaurant in the future. She joined Yehu because of the availability of various products.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. For the past three years, she has operated a fish-selling business from home. Saumu's primary customers are villagers. Saumu's other source of income includes husband's income and her greatest business challenge is seasonality. Saumu lives in a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food. She joined Yehu because of its loan products and policies.

Saumu is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to buy bundles of fish. In the future, she aspires to open a seafood shop.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Mamie Lahai

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Mamie.  She is married and has two children, aged 22 and 19 years. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because of schooling.

In 1991, Mamie established her Palm Oil and Motor Bike Services business. She began her business because she did not go to school. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business.
 
She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Mamie has already received and successfully repaid her first loan and now requires a new loan in order to purchase drums of palm oil. 

In the future, Mamie plans to build more houses.  She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drums of palm oil.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.fr:
CLIENTE  ÂGÉE DE 35ANS, CÉLIBATAIRE, MÈRE DE 3ENFANTS DONT L’AGE VARIE ENTRE 1 AN ET 7ANS ET 1 ENFANT EN CHARGE.

EN 2006, ELLE COMMENCE A VENDRE SUR UNE ÉTALAGE LES PRODUITS ALIMENTAIRES.
SON ACTIVITÉ EST  SITUE DANS UN QUARTIER OU LE BESOIN SE FAIT SENTIR ET ELLE PEUT VENDRE JUSQU’À  50.000F PAR JOUR.

L’ACTUEL PRÊT VA LUI PERMETTRE D’ACHETER : 2 CARTONS DE SUCRE, 2 CARTONS DE LAITS EN POUDRE ET EN CONCENTRÉE 
3CARTONS DE SPAGHETTI, 10 SACHETS DE BONBONS, 5 PAQUETS DE DOUZAINES DE BISCUITS, 4 DOUZAINES DES SACHETS GARNITURES, 4 DOUZAINES DES COUCHE A JETER, 2CARTONS DE SARDINES, 2 CARTONS DE CORNEED BŒUF , DES CONSERVES ET DES  PACKS D'EAU MINÉRALE.

SES AMBITIONS EST D’OUVRIR UNE BOUTIQUE ET COMMENCER A VOYAGER EN DEHORS DU PAYS POUR RENFORCER SON STOCK.
CÉLIBATAIRE, ELLE S' OCCUPE CONVENABLEMENT DE SES ENFANTS.
C’EST UNE FEMME TRAVAILLEUSE QUI SE DÉBROUILLE BIEN
texts.en:
This client is 35 years old, unmarried, and the mother of three children, from 1 to 7 years old. And she has one [other] to support. 

In 2006, she began selling grocery items from a display of goods. Her business is located in a district where there is a need. She can make sales of 50,000 francs a day. 

The current loan will enable her to buy: 2 boxes of powdered milk and concentrated milk, 3 boxes of spaghetti, 10 packets of candies, 5 dozen packets of cookies, 4 dozen packets of <i>garnitures<i/>, 4 dozen disposable pads, 2 boxes of sardines, 2 boxes of corned beef, some jam, and packs of mineral water. 

Her ambition is to open a store and begin traveling abroad in order to bolster her inventory. 

An unmarried woman, she takes care of her children appropriately. She is a hard worker who gets by quite well.

loans.use: to buy boxes of milk, spaghetti, sardines, corned beef, paper tissues, candies, and cookies.

loans.name: John Wainaina

texts.en: John is a 35-year-old married man. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a motor vehicle to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for four years and employs two people. His business is located in a busy town and his primary customers are the general public. His biggest business challenge is stiff competition within the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy motor vehicle spare parts. John dreams of becoming a well-established transport provider within five years.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, and married with two children.

Samir is a barber. In 2006 he opened his own shop, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has experience and a good reputation. His shop is located in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He hopes to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, and married with seven children.

Haydar has owned a shop since 2005, selling and fixing electronics. He has experience and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. His goal is to earn more profits to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a 48-year-old divorced woman. She has two children. Mwanakombo operates a food stall and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are villagers. 
Mwanakombo's children also work. Her greatest business challenge is credit sales and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanakombo will use the Kes 20,000 loan to start another business selling paraffin. She will purchase paraffin and resell it at a retail price. Mwanakombo aspires to open a café in the future. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paraffin for resale.

loans.name: Bessarion Kokashvili

texts.en:
Bessarion is 36 years old. He lives in a village in the Kareli District, East Georgia with his family: his wife, Liana; his three children (14, 12 and 10 years old) and his mother (who is retired). The family earns a living through agriculture. They have a 1.5-hectare plot of land, where they grow cabbage, tomatoes, garlic, plums and nuts. Bessarion and Liana work hard on their plot and sell harvested products at the local market. In spite of their hard work, the family lives below the poverty line and receives social assistance from the government. The total average monthly income of the family, including social assistance, is 650 Laris. 

Bessarion requested credit for financing their seasonal agricultural work. In particular, he will rent a tractor to till the land; purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. Bessarion hopes that the weather conditions will be favorable as well. The family hopes that it will reap a good harvest, which will be sold for a good price. Bessarion and Liana will use the income to pay for the family's daily expenses, as well as reinvesting in the family farm for future.

loans.use: to pay for land tilling services, purchase fertilizers and pesticides to protect his plants from parasites.

loans.name: Alyaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is a youth client, 22 years old and married.

Alyaa has been a tailor since 2010. She makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally, such as suits, coats and dresses for women. She has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $1,500 loan in order to purchase a split air conditioner (an air conditioner with the condensing components outdoors and the evaporator coil indoors). She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, a 33-year-old married father of two children, is from Iraq where he has owned a calf’s farm since 2001, selling dairy products. Well-experienced in this field, Ali has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas. He is now requesting a $1500 loan in order to buy a Friesian cow. Ali's goal is to earn more profits to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a Friesian cow.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Maria.  She is married and has two children, aged 13 and 10 years. 

In 2000, Maria established her fish business. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about Le 950,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Maria requires a loan in order to purchase more fish for her business.  

In the future, Maria plans to get more profit and build her own cold-room. She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Despiner

texts.en:
Despiner, a single mother of four children, two of whom are in school, lives in Kampala, Uganda where she also takes care of her elderly parents. She lives in a home that she rents, with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

For four years, Despiner has operated a business selling used clothes seven days a week at the market; her main challenges are transportation and thieves. Despiner is now requesting a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling wholesale and to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana  con su anterior credikiva, compró mercancías como suéteres masculinos, juegos de sabanas, toallas y también invirtió en la compra de pescado en mayor volumen y todo esto lo vendió y ganó un poco mas. Ahora se preparara para recibir la semana santa con mucho pescado, pues es la época en que mas se incrementan sus ventas, porque la comunidad celebra su tradición de acompañar  a Jesús con oración, sacrificios y  por eso mucha de su clientela guardando las tradiciones,   no comer carne de res y se aumenta el consumo de los productos que vende Juana justamente. Con su nuevo credikiva comprará una vez mas pescado en mayor cantidad, para dar respuesta a una temporada que llega con una lluvia de clientes.  Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias por el apoyo recibido hasta ahora, y que Dios los bendiga para que sigan apoyando a mas personas. “
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Juana bought men’s sweaters, bed sheet sets and towels, and also invested in buying a large quantity of seafood. She was able to sell everything and made a little more income than usual.  

Now Juana is gearing up for Easter and needs lots of seafood, as it’s the time of year her sales go up. This is because the community celebrates its closeness to Jesus with orations and sacrifices, and keeping with tradition means giving up beef, so people consume more of what Juana sells. Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following: “Thank you for the help I’ve received so far and may God bless you so you continue to help more people.”

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fish

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Рахматулло более 12 лет занимается торговлей. У него имеется собственная торговая точка на рынке. Он в основном занимается торговлей весовых конфет и сухофруктов. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Рахматулло берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Rahmatullo has been involved in sales for over 12 years.  He owns a retail outlet at a market.  Rahmatullo primarily sells candy by weight and dried fruits.  He is 31 years old, married and has five children.  Rahmatullo is requesting this loan to expand product selection.

loans.use: to purchase candy and nuts

loans.name: Paz Y Bien - El Tambo Group

texts.es:
La Señora DANNY EVELYNG, de 23 años de edad estado civil soltera, se caracteriza por ser muy alegre, ella es socia de la Alcancía comunal  “PAZ Y BIEN – EL TAMBO”. 
Ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de tamales. El tamal es un producto hecho a base de maiz molido, aceitunas, carne de pollo, carne de res, etc. Ella vende estos productos todos los días en el mercado de su localidad.
el préstamo lo solicita para la compra de más insumos como maiz molido, carne de res, carne de pollo, carne de cerdo, azucar, aceite, etc.
En el futuro ella desea comprarse una casa. En el video es la primera persona de la derecha, viste polo color blanco y chompa color rosada.
texts.en: Danny Evelyng, 23, is single and noted for being very cheerful and quirky.  She’s a member of the “Paz Bien-El Tambo” communal bank.  She sells tamales made from chicken, meat, etc. which is a product made from ground corn, olives, and meats such as chicken and beef.  She sells them daily in her local market.  She is asking for the loan to purchase ground corn, beef, chicken, pork, sugar, oil, etc. She’d like to buy a house in the future.  In the video she appears as the first person and is wearing a white shirt and pink jacket.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make tamales

loans.name: Arnaldo Alfredo Aliaga Vera

texts.es:
Arnaldo es un hombre trabajador y entusiasta; vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú; el distrito de Parcona es conocido por uno de sus atractivos turísticos el cual es el bosque de piedras, así como también la amabilidad de sus pobladores. En su tiempo libre a Arnaldo le gusta conversar con sus amigos por las redes sociales y también aprovecha la oportunidad para disfrutar uno de sus platos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche”, el solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Mecánica.

Día a día Arnaldo se esfuerza mucho para realizar sus labores en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 38 clientes al día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque hay mucha necesidad en su barrio para el uso de transporte y porque es muy amable con los clientes. 

Arnaldo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería (ropa)  para iniciar un nuevo negocio, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para cumplir su gran sueño” Tener una mejor calidad de Vida”.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is a hardworking, enthusiastic man living in Parcona District, Ica, Perú.  The Parcona District is known for its tourist attractions, like the Parcona Stone Forest, as well as the kindness of its residents.  In his free time Armando likes chatting with his friends in the social networks and also enjoys one of his favorite dishes which is the very delicious “Ceviche” [marinated seafood cocktail].  He only studied up to fifth grade of secondary education but would have liked to study mechanics.

Arnaldo strives day to day to do his work as a mototaxi driver.  He works about 10 hours daily and takes care of up to 38 customers daily.  He believes that he does well in his business because there is much need for transportation in his neighborhood and because he’s very nice to customers.

Arnaldo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy merchandise (clothes) to start a new business that will allow him to improve his income and continue striving toward making his great dream a reality: “To have a better quality of life.”

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Tania Judith

texts.es: La Srta. Tania es soltera, tiene 20 de edad,  Tania  estudia Textileria y comercio ella escogió esta carrera ya que su familia tiene un negocio de confección de ropa en un taller  es así que Tania gracias a lo aprendido de su carrera trabaja en el negocio de su familia y aporta ideas modernas y también cose y crea modernos diseños de ropa, ella eligió esta profesión porque  es su vocación y considera que es una chica creativa y moderna , Su sueño de Tania  es brindarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y de alguna forma devolverle a ellos todo lo que hicieron por ella, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar su matrícula y comprar una computadora multifuncional. Tania  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Miss Tania, 20, is single and studies textiles and commerce.  She chose this line of study because her family has a clothes making business and, thanks to what she is learning, she can contribute modern ideas.  She also sews and creates her own clothing fashions.  She chose this profession because it is her vocation; and she feels she is creative and modern. 

Tania's dream is to give her parents a better quality of life and in some way give back to them everything they have done for her.  In order to continue growing she has requested a new loan to pay for her tuition and to buy a multi-purpose computer.  Tania will meet her goals through a lot of hard work and effort, and with the help of the Edaprospo loans.

loans.use: To pay tuition and buy a multi-purpose computer.

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.ru: Искандар проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Искандар имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности он водитель. В этой области он работает 8 лет. Также Искандар занимается животноводством. Он берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Iskandar lives in the Dangara district.  He is 40 years old, married and has one child.  Iskandar has a secondary-specialized education and is a driver.  He has been working in this field for eight years.  Iskandar is also involved in animal husbandry.  He is requesting this loan to purchase bulls.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood, corn on the cob and cooking oil.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, quiere invertir en el negocio para crecer y poder mejorar, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo que le permita comprarse frutas y verduras frescas como: tomates, chiles, cebollas, repollo, fresas, manzanas, papayas, con esto estará surtiendo y desarrollándose en el negocio.
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo con la utilidad del préstamo anterior, ya que gracias a eso sus ingresos han aumentado y su familia cuenta con mejores oportunidades.
texts.en: María wants to invest in her business to expand and strengthen it. She is requesting a new loan so she can buy fresh fruits and vegetables, like tomatoes, peppers, onions, cabbage, strawberries, apples and papayas. This loan will allow her to restock and further develop her business. She was able to use the previous loan positively, which allowed her to increase her profits and provide her family with improved opportunities.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, cabbage, strawberries, apples and papayas.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Умедчон проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 30 лет. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает весовые конфеты, орехи и сухофрукты. Торговлей Умедчон занимается 7 лет. Он женат. Кредит берет для покупки сухофруктов.
texts.en: Umedjon lives in the city of Vahdat.  He is 30 years old.  He leases a retail outlet at a market, where he sells candy by weight, nuts and dried fruits.  Umedjon has been involved in sales for seven years.  He is married.  He is requesting this loan to purchase dried fruits.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Juan Sandoval Cajusol

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a su hijo en la zona rural ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola situada en la cuidad Lambayeque, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. 

Se dedica desde hace muchos años a trabajar en la crianza y venta de ganado ovino y aves de corral, los cuales cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside y en el mercado del distrito, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres.

Juan desea adquirir  más animales y alimento balanceado para mejorar el peso de sus animales y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juan is a 47-year-old father.  He is married and lives with his wife and his son in the rural area of the district of Mórrope, an agricultural region located in the city of Lambayeque, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He has worked for many years raising and selling sheep and poultry, which he raises behind his house.  When they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the traders who tend to visit the area where he lives and in the market of the district.  He learned this work from his parents.

Juan wants to acquire more animals and balanced feed to improve the weight of his animals and get greater profits.  For this reason he believes it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles (PEN).

loans.use: to buy livestock and balanced feed.

loans.name: Carmen Julia Vidaurre Baldera

texts.es:
Carmen Julia es una mujer de 36años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa familiar. Vive en el pueblo joven Federico Villareal, en el distrito de Túcume. La mayoría de la población son comerciantes independientes dedicados a la venta de abarrotes y animales.
La actividad a la que se dedica Carmen Julia es a la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio y a la venta de animales, con una experiencia de 3 años aproximadamente. Cuenta con clientela fija en la venta de abarrotes. Además, se dedica a la agricultura.
Con el préstamo ascendiente a 3000 nuevos soles, tiene pensado comprar artículos de primera necesidad para poder surtir su bodega, tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, harina, etc.
texts.en:
Carmen Julia is a 36-year-old woman who is single and lives at home with her family.  She lives in the new town of Federico Villareal in the district of Túcume.  The majority of the population are independent businesspeople who sell groceries and animals for a living.

Carmen Julia sells groceries from her home and she also sells animals and she has about three years of experience.  She has an established clientele in her grocery business.  She also works in agriculture.

With her loan of 3,000 nuevos soles, she plans to buy essential items to stock her grocery store, such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, flour, etc.

loans.use: to purchase groceries like rice, sugar, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de artesanías; la socia también elabora chullos, guantes, chalinas, ponchos de alpaca.La socia tiene un pequeño taller en su casa donde ella elabora sus tejidos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona emprendedora y responsable con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para la elaboracion de tejidos como lana para las chompas.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is a part of the communal bank 'Choquequirao'. The bank is a part of the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Maribel. She alternates her daily activities with the business of buying and selling local handicrafts and also making 'chullos' (Peruvian style winter hat), gloves, scarves, and sweaters made from alpaca yarn. She has a small workshop in her home where she weaves, to later sell to her customers that make requests. She is an entrepreneurial and responsible person with a great desire to continue working for her family. 

She has requested a loan to buy materials to make her woven goods, like wool for the sweaters. 

She is very satisfied and thankful for the help that she has been provided through this loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials, like wool, to weave for sweaters

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Ситора жительница района Рудаки. Возраст, 21 год. Замужем. Ее муж таксист. Сама она занимается торговлей. В этой области она два года. Кредит берет для покупки детских платьев, ползунков, костюмчиков и наборов для новорожденных.
texts.en: Sitora is a resident of the Rudaki district.  She is 21 years old, married.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  Sitora is involved in sales.  She has been in this business for two years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase children's dresses, rompers, bodysuits and sets for newborns.

loans.use: to expand the selection of children's clothing

loans.name: Mahmaddovud

texts.ru: Махмаддовуд занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. Более 2-х лет он успешно продолжает свой бизнес. В основном он выращивает бахчевые культуры. У Махмаддовуда дружная семья- жена и трое детей. В бизнесе помогает жена. Махмаддовуд запрашивает займ в размере 3500 Сомони для покупки семян пшеницы, лука и арбуза. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Mahmaddovud is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He has been successfully running his business for over two years.  He primarily grows melon crops.  Mahmaddovud has a friendly family - a wife and three children.  His wife helps him with the business.  Mahmaddovud is requesting a loan in the amount of 3500 Somoni to purchase wheat, onion and watermelon seeds.  He relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Noris Ruiz Florez

texts.es: Noris de 50 años vive con su cónyuge y ambos trabajan para aumentar cada día su bienestar en diferentes negocios, mientras él se dedica a vender  jugos naturales, ella  en el   sur occidente de la ciudad, donde habita con su esposo,  tiene un negocio de confecciones y otro donde ofrece servicios de llamadas a celulares. Noris llegó desde hace más de 30 años a la ciudad de Barranquilla,  procedente del departamento del Cesar, de donde debió emigrar por problemas de orden público que en ese momento ocurrieron. En su taller Noris fabrica especialmente sábanas, cubrelechos y desde hace 2 años agregó a su vida una nueva actividad,  para genera otros ingresos, “la de vender minutos a celulares”. Ella además tiene una motocicleta que   arrienda, y también produce ingresos. Trabaja persistentemente porque su sueño es tener su propia casa mas adelante y ampliar su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará telas para elaborar sabanas y cubrelechos en mayor cantidad. Con ello generará mayores ingresos, pues responderá a su clientela vendiéndole lo que ellos esperan,  mas si está por llegar el día de las madres, dia en que justamente regalan a ellas, la mercancia que Noris vende, lo que potencializa el éxito de esta inversión..
texts.en:
Noris, 50 years old, lives with her husband, and both work daily to augment their well-being in different businesses. While he sells natural juices, she,  has a sewing business and sells cell phone minutes in the southeastern sector of the city where they live,.

Noris arrived in the city of Baranquilla some 30 years ago, directly from Cesar Department, from which she had to migrate due to the lack of public order at that time. In her shop, Noris makes, especially, sheets and bedcovers, and starting 2 years ago, added a new activity to generate additional income -- selling cell phone minutes. She also has a motorcycle to rent and that too produces income.

Noris persistently works hard because she dreams of having her own house in the future and of expanding her business. At present, she is applying for a “credikiva” (a Kiva loan), her 1st financing through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to buy cloth for making sheets and bedspreads in larger quantity. This will enable her to earn more income by providing her clientele with what they want. After all, Mother's Day is coming, when Noris's merchandise is appropriate and sells well, assuring the success of this investment.

loans.use: buy cloth to make sheets and  bedspreads in larger quantities to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina;la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía como en la elaboracion de tejidos como chompas,chuyos,chalinas y guantes, para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo este  negocio el medio por el cual ella saca adelante a su familia brindandole satisfaciones tanto economicas como personales.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para la elaboracion de su mercaderia como lanas de diferentes colores para confecconar las chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the”CHOQUEQUIRAO” communal bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and teh deparment of Cusco.

This member is Señora Marcelina.  She combines her daily activities with her business selling handicrafts, like the sweaters, hats, scarves and gloves that she knits and later sells to her customers who request them.  Marcelina is a responsible and earnest person who feels that this business is the means by which she can move her family ahead in life.  This provides her with satisfaction, as much on a financial level as on a personal level.

Marcelina is requesting the loan to purchase materials for making her merchandise, such as different colors of wool for making sweaters.

Marcelina is happy about the loan and agrees to comply with her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making her merchandise, such as different colors of wool for making sweaters.

loans.name: Azar Aliyev

texts.en:
Azar is 34 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Azar lives in the Fuzuli region together with his friendly family.  He has been involved in transporting construction materials to various sites for five years.  Azar primarily transports cement, sand and stone.  Currently, he needs 1600 AZN to purchase spare parts in order to repair his Kamaz truck.  Azar says that because his Kamaz does not work now, he cannot earn his monthly income, and this is why he needs this loan in order to return to his work.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is a person who have been forced or obliged to flee his home, in particular as a result of an armed conflict, violence, violations of human rights or natural or human-made disasters, and who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an internationally recognised State border and remains on the territory of his own country. (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs)

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Rashadet Rustamov

texts.ru:
Etot molodoy chelovek zanimayestya skotovodstvom uje 5 let. Kogda on nachinal svoy bizness on razvodil ovec no seychas on nachal razvodit korov. Tak kak on obnavil svoy bizness seychas Reshadet nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya togo chtob uvelichit svoy bizness. Rashadet 29 let. On jenat i imenyet 3 prekrasnix detey. Ne smotrya na svoy molodoy vozrast on rano jenilsya, preobrel semyu i detey. On xochet razvit svoy bizness i uvelichit svoi mesachniye doxodi chtobi soderjat svoyu bolshuyu semyu. 
On jivet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy, yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda. Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)
texts.en:
This young man has been involved in animal husbandry for five years.  When he first started his business, he bred sheep, but now began to breed cattle.  Because he updated his business, Rashadet needs 2000 AZN to purchase cattle in order to expand his business.  Rashadet is 29 years old, married and has three beautiful children.  Despite his young age, he married early and got a family and children.  He wants to develop his business and increase his monthly income in order to provide for his large family.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is a person who have been forced or obliged to flee his home, in particular as a result of an armed conflict, violence, violations of human rights or natural or human-made disasters, and who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an internationally recognised State border and remains on the territory of his own country. (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs)

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para darle continuidad  al negocio,pues ella despues del ultimo prestamo, instalo una tienda, que pretende surtir de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, aceite, frijoles, huevos, azúcar, todo esto le permitirá tener más mercaderia en el negocio y poder mejorar la atención a los clientes.
Ella manifiesta haber obtenido una buena ayuda con su préstamo anterior, invirtiéndolo en cerdos y nuevos productos para atraer a la clientela, dándole oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca has decided to ask for a new loan to provide continuity for her business, as after the last loan she set up a store which she intends to stock up with everyday products such as rice, oil, beans, eggs. and sugar.  This will allow her to have more merchandise in her business, and be able to improve service for her customers.

She demonstrates that she has received good assistance from her earlier loan; she invested it in pigs and new products to attract customers, providing her the opportunity to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, beans, eggs and sugar.

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en:
Lukiya lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, two of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

Lukiya has a business of selling used clothes. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Lukiya sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail.

Lukiya has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. She also generates additional income through selling piped water. The main business challenges for Lukiya include transportation and increasing prices of used clothes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale and to build rental rooms. Lukiya lives in a home that she owns; she has access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.fr:
Abdoul fait partie du groupe Umoja ni nguvu. Il a 52 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 8 ans à 30 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Il a 2 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Abdoul est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées et des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Abdoul voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Abdoul is a member of the group Umoja ni nguvu. He is 52 years old and married with six children aged 8 to 30 years old, and two of them go to school. He has two other dependents aside from his children. His education level is five years of primary school.

Abdoul is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use the credit to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor. 

His business growth strategy is to use selected seeds and to chemical fertilizers. In the coming years, Abdoul hopes to become the leading farmer in his region. He will use his profits to provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Selome 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SELOME 3 est composé de huit personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Séraphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Séraphine est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée. Séraphine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Séraphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Séraphine vend depuis huit ans du maïs et de l'igname de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Séraphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Séraphine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SELOME 3, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group SELOME 3 comprises eight persons who reside in the same district. This is the third time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. 

The group's representative, Séraphine, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 41 years old and married. Séraphine did not attend school. The couple have six children, all in school and in their care. Séraphine lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in covering the different household expenses. 

To help meet the different needs of the family, Séraphine has been selling corn and yams door to door for eight years. This business enables her to support herself without much trouble. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, Séraphine, along with the other members of the group SELOME 3, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of yams and corn

loans.name: Altynbubu

texts.ru:
Алтынбубу 53 года. С 2008 года Алтынбубу занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 40,000 сом (KGS). В настоящее время в хозяйстве Алтынбубу имеется  2 дойные коровы, 5 овец, 5 лошадей, приносящих около 5,000 сом (KGS)   в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алтынбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Алтынбубу планирует частично вложить в закуп стройматериалов для дома, а в дальнейшем - в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Altynbubu is 53 years old.  She has been involved in animal husbandry since 2008, after starting this business with an initial amount of 40,000 som (KGS).  At the present time, Altynbubu's business contains two dairy cows, five sheep and five horses, and yields about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products.  In order to further develop her business, Altynbubu requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan partially into a purchase of construction materials for her house and into expansion of her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hector Rosendo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Hector , el socio es docente de profesión, el socio trabaja en un colegio particular y tambien es docende en una institucion educativa; el socio trabaja durante el dia ; el socio se encuentra actualmente estudiando un post grado,  el socio desea el crédito para pagar los estudios de sus hijos , el socio es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

El socio solicito el prestamo para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.

El socio se encuentra agradecido con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "CHOQUEQUIRAO". This bank is located in the Huanchac district in Cusco province, in the department of Cusco. The member's name is Hector, he is a teacher by profession, and he works at a private school and is also a teacher at an educational institution. He works in the daytime and is currently studying for his post graduate degree. He wants the loan to pay for his children's education. He is a responsible person with a strong desire to come out ahead for his family.

He is asking for the loan to pay for his children's education.

He is grateful for the loan granted him, and he is committed to repaying in installments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to pay for his children's education.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Hamisi  is a 40-year-old married man. He has 4 children and all are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Riziki and she works as a house wife. 

Hamisi operates a milk sales business and sells his goods from home.  He's worked in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are the villagers. He describes his greatest business challenge to be market conditions and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Hamisi will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase milking equipment and cow salt. Hamisi  aspires to open a milk depot in the future. He joined Yehu because of its low interest rate and good public relations.

loans.use: buy milking equipments and cow salt

loans.name: Mohammed Kingade

texts.en:
Mohamed  is a 55-year-old married man. He has 8 children and 6 are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Amina and she works as a businesswoman. 

Mohamed  operates a grocery business and sells his goods in a shop. He's worked in this business for 2 years. His primary customers are local villagers. Mohamed 's other source of income comes from rental premises.  He describes his greatest business challenge to be market competition and his highest monthly expense is school fees. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mohamed will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy sacks of tomatoes and potatoes for resale.  Mohamed  aspires to open a wholesale grocery store in the future. He joined Yehu because of its good public relations.

loans.use: buy tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a 35-year-old married woman. He has 4 children and all are enrolled in school. Masika operates a business selling charcoal and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are the local villagers. Masika's other source of income includes her  husband's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be price fluctuations. Her highest monthly expense is school fees. Masika owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Masika will use this KES 15,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell.  She aspires to open a wholesale business in the future. She joined Yehu because of its low interest rate and good public relations.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Minondjou Group

texts.fr: MINONDJOU est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Viviane (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 34 ans. Viviane ne vit plus avec son mari, mais a un enfant qui est scolarisé et à sa charge. Viviane vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule ses différentes charges. Viviane a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Viviane mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d'année, la vente de tissus dans un marché du Bénin. Viviane s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Viviane sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe MINONDJOU un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MINONDJOU is a group composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Viviane (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 34 years old. She no longer lives with her husband but haa one child, who is in school and in her care. Viviane lives alone with her child and ensures by herself the different expenses are covered. 

Viviane halted her studies in primary school. To cope with supporting herself, she has been running a business selling cloth for about ten years at a market in Benin. She gets her supplies  from Benin. 

With the goal of responding better to the burgeoning customer base and to make more profit, Viviane, along with the other members of the group MINONDJOU, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy cloth

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Mr. Altangerel, 28 has a vegetable farm with potatoes, carrots and onions on his own plot of land. After harvesting, he sells the vegetables to the markets in the city. He lives in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia, with his wife and 2 children. He has been running his business for 7 years. His business usually has risks of the natural disasters or market issues. Last year his business had a loss with a small harvest. It was caused by the insects, pests and lack of fertilizer, as he concluded. Therefore, this year he decided to prevent this kind of risk. Now, he needs to purchase some kinds of organic fertilizers from trusted Russian suppliers. The cost is quite high for him. The loan he is requesting will be dedicated to purchasing organic fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jose Julio

texts.es:
Julio, necesita nuevamente comprar insumos agrícolas por  eso a través de este préstamo comprara los materiales necesarios  como el abono, herbicidas e insectisidas y pagara el arrendamiento del terreno.
El considera que el préstamo anterior fue un gran aporte que le ayudo para desarrollar el cultivo de maíz y frijol garantizándole los granos básicos para la alimentación de la familia así como para la venta de ellos.
texts.en: Julio needs to buy agricultural supplies once again. So with this loan he will buy the necessary materials such as fertilizer, herbicide, and insecticide; and he will pay the rent on his land. He thinks the last loan was a big contribution that helped him a lot in developing the cultivation of corn and beans; guaranteeing him the basic grains to feed his family, as well as selling them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and insecticide, and to pay the rent on the land.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 50 years old.  She lives in a small village in Kareli district. She is a widow and lives alone. 

Diana is a teacher in a local kindergarten. Along with her main job, Diana earns a living through an agricultural business. She has a small dairy farm with a milk cow and a calf. Diana produces cheese and sells it in the village.  Along with the abovementioned, she owns 2.2 hectares of land, where cabbages, haricots and wheat are grown. Diana sells the harvested products locally to green grocery products retailers. Her total average monthly income is 500 Laris. 

Diana requested credit for the cultivation of her land and purchasing of fertilizers. She will work hard during the spring season to get a good harvest in the summer and fall.  A small part of the credit will be used to purchase hay for the cow and the calf.  She will need to supply them with hay until May. In May there will be fresh grass available. Diana will sell her harvested products through known distribution channels and get the expected income, which will be used for daily expenses.

loans.use: cultivate land and buy fertilizers and cattle feed

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr: Le groupe CONFIANCE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Patricia Josette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Patricia Josette est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un certain Epiphane. Patricia Josette a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Patricia Josette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Patricia Josette vend depuis huit ans des mèches, des produits cosmétiques, des liqueurs dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Patricia Josette vend des chaussures et des tissus. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Patricia Josette s’approvisionne au Bénin et à Lomé. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Patricia Josette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe CONFIANCE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group CONFIANCE comprises three persons who reside in the same district. This is the third time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. 

The group's representative, Patricia Josette, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 40 years old and married to a man named Epiphane. Patricia Josette halted her studies in primary school. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. Patricia Josette lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in covering the different household expenses. 

To help meet the different needs of the family, Patricia Josette has been selling hair extensions, cosmetics, and liquor in her district for eight years. Secondarily, she sells shoes and cloth. This business enables her to support herself without much trouble. She gets her supplies from Benin and from Lomé. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, Patricia Josette, along with the other members of the group CONFIANCE, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy cloth, shoes, hair extensions, liquor, and cosmetics

loans.name: Muibullo

texts.ru: Муйбулло трудолюбивый и добрый семьянин. Жена не работает, занимается домохозяйством и воспитывает детей. Более 3-х лет Муйбулло занимается выращиванием сельхозпродукции, а также откормом скота. Отходы от выращивания идут на корм скота, и ему выгодно содержит скот. Муйбулло запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и покупки скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Muibullo is a hardworking and kind family man.  His wife does not work and is involved in household work and raising the children.  Muibullo has been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up livestock for over three years.  The leftovers from growing go toward feeding the livestock, and it is profitable for Muibullo to keep livestock.  Muibullo is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and livestock.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and cattle

loans.name: Safarkhon

texts.ru: Сафархон трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет двух детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более одного года он занимается продажей дисков предоставлением услуг парикмахера. Сафархон хочет создать условия для своего дома и улучшить своё жильё. С этой целью Сафархон запрашивает займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки стройматериалов. Сафархон надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Safarkhon is a hardworking and kind person.  He is married and has two children.  His wife is involved in household work.  Safarkhon has been involved in selling discs and providing barber services for over one year.  He wants to create better conditions for his home and improve his living space.  Safarkhon is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 Somoni to purchase construction materials for this purpose.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: David Bitadze

texts.en:
David is 33 years old. He lives in the village of Khviti with his family: wife – Nina, two sons and his parents.  All adult family members are involved in the family agricultural business, which is the only source of the income for the family.  In particular, they have 3 hectares of land where tomatoes, maize and haricots are grown.  David sells the harvested products on the local market. Also, the family has a milk cow, the dairy products from which are mainly used by the family, and the surplus is sold in the village. The total average monthly income for the family is 900 Laris.

David requested credit to finance seasonal agricultural work on their plot of land. He will pay to till the land, purchase tomato and cabbage seeds and fertilizers. The family members will work hard on the land during spring and summer. They hope that the weather conditions will be favorable and they will get a good harvest in the summer and fall.   David will sell the products locally. 

David and Nina want to make some savings from the received income to renovate their house, as it is already old and needs some repair.

loans.use: pay for land tilling service and buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Finda.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 25 and 20 yrs.  She has 2 additional dependents. 

In 2007, Finda established her palm oil and garri business. She began her business because she was unable to further her education and needed to be self-employed.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. 

Finda would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more garri and palm oil.  In the future, she plans to build more houses.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy garri and palm oil

loans.name: Banco Mujer Luz De Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Doña Mónica es otra de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Luz de Esperanza, tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Vive con su esposo y su hijo menor. Ella es una mujer muy valiente y trabajadora, su familia ha tenido que afrontar muchas situaciones difíciles,  su esposo por invalidez esta jubilado, la pensión que recibe es muy baja, y a su hijo menor este año no lo pudo mandar al colegio por falta de recursos. Sin embargo a ella nada la desanima, por el contrario trabaja aún más para salir adelante. 
Este es el primer crédito que solicita y sabe que es una gran oportunidad para desarrollar su microempresa, que es la cría de cerdos, el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de animales, concentrados, y vitaminas. 
El principal objetivo de Doña Mónica, es generar  ingresos para ayudar a su familia, y darles los estudios básicos a su hijo menor. 
Con Mónica están 2 señoras más que también van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Mónica is another of the members of Banco Mujer Luz de Esperanza. She is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her husband and her younger son. She is a very brave and hardworking woman. Her family has had to face many difficult situations, her husband is on disability retirement, and the pension he receives is very low. And this year she couldn't send her younger son to school for a lack of funds. Nevertheless, nothing discourages her, on the contrary she works even harder to get ahead.

This is the first loan she is asking for and she knows it's a great opportunity to develop her small business, which is raising pigs. She will invest the loan in buying animals, feed, and vitamins.
Mónica's main objective is to generate income to help her family, and give her younger son a basic education.
There are two women with Mónica who are also going to invest in agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, with which to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of goods with which to stock her store.

loans.name: Anis

texts.en: Anis is a 63-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and has only one working child. He’s the main income provider for the family and has big responsibilities to care for.  He has been working as a vegetables trader since 1980.  He has his own van in which he transports his products all over the villages.  Today, he’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of vegetables to be able to carry on his work properly and therefore increase his profits. In the future, he plans to enhance his work and hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Guram Gogaladze

texts.en:
Guram is 52 years old. He lives in a small village in Kareli District with his family: wife – Nargiz and two sons (18 and 15 years old) who both go to school. 

The family earns a living through a family agricultural business. They own 10 hectares of land where maize, haricots, wheat and barley are grown. Also on the same land, Guram has strawberry and apple gardens. Along with the above-mentioned, the family also runs a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows and 2 calves. Nargiz produces cheese and sells it in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

Guram has a tractor and uses it for the agricultural work on his plot of land.  He has requested credit to purchase fuel for the tractor to till the land and to buy fertilizers.  After properly doing the seasonal work, the family will get a good harvest, which will be sold for a convenient price.  Also, part of the requested credit will be used to start-up a pig farm. Guram will purchase piglets and raise them. After 6-8 months, Guram will start selling the pigs from his farm.  This new business initiative will give additional income to the family. Guram will use increased income to finance his children’s education.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, fuel for his tractor, and piglets.

loans.name: Nakhtiya

texts.ru: Нахтия более 25 лет занимается торговлей. Ей 46 лет. Она вдова. У нее один ребенок. Она в основном занимается торговлей тканей оптом. Кредит берет для приобретения тканей с вышивками и бисером.
texts.en: Nakhtiya has been involved in sales for over 25 years.  She is 46 years old, a widow and has one child.  Nakhtiya primarily sells fabrics wholesale.  She is requesting this loan to purchase embroidered and beaded fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase embroidered and beaded fabrics

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 53-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and his only working child. He’s the main source of income for his family. 

Hasan started his own business as a taxi driver in 1987 and is looking forward to gain more clients. He’s good and friendly and that's what makes people loyal to him. 

Today, Hasan is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen S.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his car and pay its mechanic fees.  He’s sure that this will improve his business and therefore increase his revenues.  In the future, he plans to buy a van to be able to serve a wider range of people.

loans.use: pay maintenance cost for his taxi

loans.name: Halima Kololo

texts.en:
Halima is a 49-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. Her husband's name is Abdalla and he works as a businessman. Halima operates a coconut selling business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are the general public. She describes her greatest business challenge to be price fluctuation.  Her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Halima will use the Kes 70,000 loan to purchase a stock of 1000 coconuts. Halima aspires to become a coconut dealer in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: buy coconut

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 56-year-old Lebanese widowed woman. She lives with her only working child and two of her relatives. She cooperates with her daughter in order to fulfill their family needs. 

In the year 2000, Hiyam started her own homemade food business. She makes delicious and delightful food. She also delivers her products to the neighboring villages upon requests. 

Today, Hiyam has the intention to take a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new refrigerator for her business, where she can keep her food in good conditions. In the future, she plans to open her own restaurant.

loans.use: a refrigerator

loans.name: Yenawa Group

texts.fr: Le groupement YENAWA est composé de quatorze personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Vianney est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leurs activités, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Vianney a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire puis a appris la coiffure. Vianney est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un certain Clément. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Vianney et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Vianney exerce le métier de coiffure depuis sept ans. Parallèlement à cette activité qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables,Vianney vend des mèches, des chaines et du maïs par le système de distribution. Vianney achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Vianney et les autres membres du groupement YENAWA sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The YENAWA group consists of fourteen members who live in the same village. The group’s representative is Vianney, raising her hand in the photo. 
The group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the second time to bolster their activities. 

Vianney attended primary school, and then learned to become a hairdresser. She is 29 years old, and married to a man named Clément. The couple have two dependent children who both go to school. Vianney and her husband live with their children, and handle together the various household responsibilities. 

In order to help support her family, Vianney has been working as a hairdresser for seven years. Along with this activity, which brings in substantial income, she also sells hair extensions, chains and corn through the distribution system. She buys her merchandise in a city of Benin. 

Vianney and the other members of YENAWA are seeking a second loan from ALIDé to strengthen their working capital and better serve their customers. Their goal is to bolster their activities.

loans.use: to buy hair products and hair extensions.

loans.name: Hikoyat

texts.ru: Хикоят жительница города Исфара. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Хосият занимается торговлей тканей на рынке. В этой области она десять лет. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Hikoyat is a resident of the city of Isfara.  She is 44 years old, married and has three children.  Hikoyat is involved in selling fabrics at a market.  She has been in this business for ten years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Evgenia

texts.en:
Evgenia is a 36-year-old farmer from a small village in Kareli District. She is a widow and lives with her children: an 18-year-old daughter and a 16-year-old son. Both of them go to local school. Evgenia earns a living through an agricultural business. The family has a small dairy farm with two milk cows and two calves. Evgenia produces various dairy products (such as cheese and yogurt) and sells them in the village. In addition, the family owns one hectare of land, where Evgenia grows tomatoes, cabbage, and peppers. Harvested products are sold locally as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 530 Georgia Laris (GEL).

Evgenia requested credit for purchasing vegetable seeds and fertilizers. She also has an old tractor, which is out of order. Part of the credit will be used for repairing it. After the tractor is fixed, Evgenia will rent it out for additional income. She will use the increased income for financing the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for tractor repairing service.

loans.name: Gia Palelashvili

texts.en:
Gia is 40 years old. He lives in a small village in the Gori District of East Georgia. Gia is married and lives with his family: wife – Ekaterine, 8-year-old daughter and 6-year-old son.  The children go to school. 

The family earns a living through agriculture. They own 2.5 hectares of land where Gia and Ekaterine grow garlic, maize, peaches and apples. They sell the harvested fruits and vegetables locally to green grocery product retailers. Along with the above-mentioned, the family has a milk cow, the dairy products from which are mainly consumed by the family members, and the small surplus is sold in the village.  

The family owns an old tractor  which is mainly used for the cultivation of their own land.  Gia has requested credit to purchase fuel for the tractor to till the land. Also, he plans to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to protect the plants from parasites. Gia and Ekaterine will work hard during spring and summer.  They hope that the weather is favorable and the family will get a good harvest, which will be sold for a good price. Gia and Ekaterine plan to save a part of the received income to renovate their house, as it is already old and is in bad condition.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel for his tractor

loans.name: Farizakhon

texts.ru: Фаризахон жительница города Исфара. Она занимается торговлей детской одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается восемь лет. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Фаризахон берет кредит для покупки колготок, рубашек и брюк.
texts.en: Farizakhon is a resident of the city of Isfara.  She is involved in sales of children's clothing.  She has been in this business for eight years.  She is 37 years old, married and has five children.  Farizakhon is requesting this loan to purchase stockings, shirts and pants.

loans.use: to purchase stockings, shirts and pants

loans.name: Salim

texts.ru: Салим житель города Истаравшан. Он занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур для торговли. В основном он нанимает дехканинов для посева и выращивания овощей. У него имеется большой участок земли. В этой области Салим двадцать лет. Ему 51 год. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений.
